column6: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: A second day of protests at UNAMID base in Kass. Foreign Ministry claims UNAMID fired on protesters, killing a second protester.
SAF fire at human rights activist on a motorcycle, injuring him and then arresting him.
Masked men attack a journalist and publisher of al-Mustaqilla newspaper at his house in Khartoum, following publication of columns criticizing White Nile state government.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF shelled a well 1.5km north of Fanga. 3 killed.
SPLM-N recaptures Kululu Hills in South Kordofan. 15 soldiers killed. 2 rebels injured.
Shopkeepers closed shops in protest of growing insecurity in Al Fasher.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF, and took control of Buram in South Darfur. 63 soldiers wounded. Unknown number killed.
Militiamen opened fire at the Naivasha Market in Abu Shouk camp near Al Fasher. 4 injured.
Ethnic militia clash in Abu Dangal, two deaths reported.
Clashes between a group of cattle rustlers and a vigilante militia in area north of Abu Dungul and Keleikeli Abu Salama, in Abu Karaynka locality, 8 killed.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: JEM and SLA forces clash with the RSF in Buram, Sesseban and Antikina. Casualties not known.
Weapons Seizure: Military forces capture JEM ""logistical assets"" from Rahad El Birdi, south of Nyala. No reported causalities.
Civilians attacked by an unknown actor in Mellit. One death reported.

Dozens of students at the University of Bakhtalruda held a sit-in on campus to protest the study environment. Police and security raided the campus and used tear gas and batons to disperse the students. Dozens detained.
SCP members held gatherings at El Kalakla Laffa and Bahri bus station in Khartoum to demand the release of political detainees. Some arrested.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Nakhara and Antakina. Exact number of fatalities unreported - A UN report claims the JEM forces were completely overwhelmed with the possibility of occurring 750 fatalities between this and a battle at Goz Dango.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column16: Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga; Sudan News Agency; Radio Tamazuj
column17: Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Goz Dango military camp near Tullus. Government claims to have repulsed rebel forces. Dozens of soldiers killed including an RSF commander - A UN report claims the JEM forces were completely overwhelmed with the possibility of occurring 750 fatalities between this and a battle at Goz Dango.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Dimsu.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF run over and kill a boy in Umm Haleeb camp, firing heavily into the air as the convoy passed.
16 killed, 11 injured in SAF air strikes in El Tomat, 50km south of Tullus.
SAF bomb Angarto. One boy injured.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: JEM and SLA forces clash with the RSF in Buram, Sesseban and Antikina. Casualties not known.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: JEM and SLA forces clash with the RSF in Buram, Sesseban and Antikina. Casualties not known.
Dozens of students staged a sit-in at the market of El Obeid in protest of re-election of al-Bashir. Some students detained.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Dimsu for second day.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Nakhara region for second day.
Clashes between police and suspected Maaliya militia in Al Fado, 35km north of Ad Daein, after militia raided cattle from a Rizaygat tribe. 2 police killed, 8 civilians injured.
Gunmen torched the market in Haraza in Katila locality. One villager injured. PDF offices were of the buildings burned.
JEM clashes with military and destroy camp in Ghubaysh locality near the border with North Darfur. Several government forces killed, 38 vehicles captures.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: 3 bombs dropped near El Malha, one detonated, destroying property in Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) ammunition store.
A man in Turbo was killed by unexploded ordance.

column9: NISM: National Islamist Students Movement; Darfur Students' Association
column17: 150 NCP students and university guards attacked National Islamist Students Movement and Darfur Students Association members at Sharg el Nil University in Khartoum. Used metal bars, crutches and machetes. 1 died, dozens injured. Dozens detained.
Protests at El Azhari University in Khartoum North against the violence against students that occurred earlier that day at Sahrg el Nil University in Khartoum. Police dispersed crowds with tear gas.
SAF bomb Mendi near Kauda. 2 killed.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: At least 16 killed - including 2 Abu Tira troops - and injured in clashes between Rizaygat and Maaliya militia in Abu Karaynka.
Unidentified persons attack Medan al Kheil, North Darfur. One death reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked villages of Finij and Ndjamena, 20km south of Abu Zabad. 6 Kasha tribe members wounded.
Pro-government militia beat three women and two men near Alban Jadeed camp. All five civilians treated in hospital.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Security agents aducted two students near Kalma camp.
Pro-government militia abducted three men near Omi, near Nierteti.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: El Ahliya University students in Omdurman protest the Apr 29 attack on Darfuri students that occurred at Sharg el Nil University in Khartoum. Student protesters allegedly beaten and detained by NISS.
SAF bomb Malamm. No casualties reported.
Unidentified persons attack civilians in al Jeer, Nyala. One death reported.
Agreement: Maaliya and Rizaygat tribes released two captives, one from each side, in Abu Karaynka.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Unidentified perpetrators fire mortars at UNAMID targets at Tullus. No reported injury.
Nine gunmen attacked villagers in Ailliet locality. 1 killed 2 wounded.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between military/RSF and SLM/A-Minnawi and an allied SLM faction in Khor Salman and Jumeiza, 30km southwest of Kutum. 60 soldiers and 4 rebels killed, 9 injured.
4 killed, 4 injured by gunmen attack on a commercial convoy on El Fasher-Kabkabiya Road near Korma.
Attack at Kassab IDP camp in Narth Darfur by unknown persons, one injury reported.
Pro-government militia rape a girl near Shangil Tobay.

Movement of forces: South Sudan forces reportedly withdraw from Samaha area between Sudan and South Sudan following an April 26 battle in Goz Dango near Tullus (South Darfur), between SLM/A-Minawi faction / JEM vs. Sudanese military / RSF. South Sudan denies reports that it were ever stationed in Samaha.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF raped 2 women in Kuro north of Deribat.
Gunmen kill 1 man in Kalam Basanan west of Bindisi.
Darfuri female students protest against what they claim to be deliberate torching of their dorm residences at University of Bahri in Khartoum. Police claim the fire was electrical fault.
Tamar militia clashes with an unknown actor, reasons unknown in Kalamhasina. One fatality reported.
Military and pro-government militia attack villages of Shat Damam, Trawi, Mazariq, and Hajar Dabib. 3 civilians killed. 40 abducted.
SAF opened fire and brought down a suspected Israeli drone carrying 2 missiles at 11pm May 5, in Kereri area north of Omdurman.
Abala militia armed by the government assaulted civilians in Hemeda, Dalma and Shurfa in East Jebel Marra.
5 militiamen in military uniforms raped a girl near Abu El Rish near Sirba.
SAF opened fire on Wadi Sayidna near Khartoum, reportedly to target a photo surveillance aircraft. No casualties.
Militiamen shot a man and his son (the father died) in Mirair, Bielel locality.
Pro-government militia shot a man dead in area west of Niteaga.
Woman and son from Fayarin clan of Misseriya tribe were killed by unknown group in Donki Al Binjabir village near meriam
Mother and child killed in aerial bombardment of Fanga.
Change to armed group: JEM sub-group led by Jobril Ibrahim announce defection from JEM.

column9: Dinka Ngok Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Women (South Sudan)
column17: Misseriya militia abducted three Dinka Ngok women in Abyei while they were collecting firewood. The women were taken to an area called Maker to show where Misseriya could find cattle belonging to Dinka Ngok. Women were released later that day.
Pro-government militiamen raped and abducted girls in North Darfur from May 7-9.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Security agents detain Darfuri students in Khartoum and assaulted them in El Sunut forest.
Clashes between military, SAF and SPLM-N in Bagis, Blue Nile state. Dozens of soldiers and one rebel killed in clashes in Bagis and Kilgo (7 fatalities coded for Kilgo, 6 for Bagis).
Clashes between military, SAF and SPLM-N in Kilgo, Blue Nile state. Dozens of soldiers and one rebel killed in clashes in Bagis and Kilgo (7 fatalities coded for Kilgo, 6 for Bagis).
SAF bomb Kaguro. No human casualties reported.
SDF and SLA forces clash near Rockero, Central Darfur. Six fatalities, one injury.
Strike:Doctors go on strike at Kosti Hopsital over lack of medical equipment.
Militia attacked Um Liona and shot a man dead. 1 injured.
Second day of clashes between military and SLPM-N in Kilgo.
Pro-government militiamen raped and abducted girls in North Darfur from May 7-9.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 200 RSF in armed vehicles attacked Dobo El Madrasa, killing 3 civilians. 7 villagers injured. Several children were abducted.
Pro-government militiamen raped and abducted girls in North Darfur from May 7-9.
Attack against civilians in El Gasour. One civilian reported dead.
Third day of clashes between military and SLPM-N in Kilgo. 13 soldiers and 1 rebel dead on third day of battle.
Attack against civilians in Asarti, West Darfur. One death reported.
Fourth day of clashes between military, SAF and SPLM-N in Kilgo, Blue Nile state.

column7: Militia (Pro-Government); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Military, allied miitia and security apparatus attacked, torched Medeim El Jebel village in Bau locality, causing 2,000 to flee their homes.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Military and RSF attack SPLM-N-controlled villages in Buram. 3 civilians killed.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Military and RSF attack SPLM-N-controlled village of El Hadra. 6 civilians killed.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Unidentified perpetrators fire shots from 500m at UNAMID personnel. No casualties reported.

column16: Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga; Radio Tamazuj; AFP
column17: Clashes between Rizaygat and Maaliya militia in Abu Karinka. UNAMID reports 107 dead and 57 injured.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in Kalgi, 35kms southwest of Ed Damazin.
NCP student members attacked Darfuri students with machetes and metal bars at the University of Bahri in Khartoum. 3 students injured.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Darfuri Students Association members at University of Sennar protest against not receiving benefits for the student support fund. Security forces chased students into dorms, using sticks to beat them, and used tear gas.
Darfuri Students Association announced the disappearance of 8 students from the University of Dongola, after NCP students stormed their residences, torched the buildings and abducted the students.
Journalist protested in front of the presidential palace in Khartoum demanding that al-Bashir intervene to stop the clashes between Rizaygat and Maaliya militia in Abu Karinka.
Clashes between Rizaygat and Maaliya militia in Abu Karinka. UNAMID reports 107 dead and 57 injured.
Armed group shot a woman in both legs in Kutum.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF raped three sisters that they had kidnapped from Gereida.

For second day, NCP student members attacked Darfuri students with knives and metal bars at the University of Bahri in Khartoum. Police intervened to vacate the university. NCP then chased students in El Kadaro district. 17 injured.
Pro-government militia abduct a man in Kutum.
Militiamen attacked and injured two men along Armankul-Tendelti road.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack and injure IDPs in Forika 1 camp in Gereida.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
column17: Military intelligence agents beat an IDP in Armankul camp, Sirba. He was released after 2 days.
SAF bomb Umm Sidr. One herder killed. Only water well in the area destroyed,
Pro-government militiamen attacked IDPs collecting firewood and abducted one from Sese camp, east of El Geneina.
Strike:Merchants in Kutum market went on strike in protest of insecurity in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF assaulted and robbed civilians in Turri, South Darfur.

Minister of social affairs, of the Maaliya ethnic group, attacked with a knife after a meeting with security regarding the the clashes between Rizaygat and Maaliya militia on May 11-12. Sustained minor injuries.
Militiamen assault 3 IDPs from Fata Borno camp in Kutum.
Mahariya and Najah militias clash in Anderi, West Darfur. One fatality reported.
Pro-government militiamen rape a girl of the Deleig camp.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF kill 2 IDPs from Camp Alef near Gereida, South Darfur. When IDPs went to the police in Gereida, RSF intercepted and began firing.
IDPs called for the dismissal of the commissioner of Gereida locality, throwing stones at him and police as they arrived at Camp Alef following RSF shooting and killing 2 IDPs.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Nemra. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.
Militiamen beat a group of displaced women in Jedo, east of Garsila.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Dolma. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Safra Humeida. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Sharafa and Abu Zeriga. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Tokomaya. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Masaleit. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Security service beat the head of the students association at a university in El Manaseer.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Nemra. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Dolma. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Tokomaya. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Safra Humeida. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Sharafa and Abu Zeriga. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in 75 armed vehicles raided Masaleit. Unknown number of villagers injured, others disappears and at least 3 women raped in RSF attacks across seven villages in Tawila locality over May 17-18.
A woman and her daughter killed, three wounded in an attack by a soldier in Ad Damazin.

column7: Militia (Pro-Government); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
column17: Military, allied miitia and security apparatus attacked, torched villages of Megenza, Begeis, and Abu Gerin in area of Engassana in Bau, causing 1,700 to flee their homes.
Pro-government militiamen attacked displaced farmers in Tarny.
SAF dropped 8 bombs on Tabsa. No casualties reported.
Pro-government militiamen attacked displaced farmers in Kunjara.
Pro-government militiamen attacked displaced farmers in Umm Burmal.
Pro-government militiamen attacked displaced farmers in Jeili.
Pro-government militiamen attacked displaced farmers in Tina, Siswa, Bawabat Sejeli and Hillet Tendel.
Tea sellers from Gereida camp staged a sit-in against the detention of a colleague. Teachers in the camp also began a strike in protest of the reduction of salaries.
Unidentified persons attack civilians in Shakshaku. One reported injury.
Air forces attack Arshin and Menyo, North Darfur. 16 dead, 90 injured.
Clashes between military and SPLM-N in Kalgo, 45km west of Ed Damazin. 11 soldiers killed.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services; Students (Sudan)
column17: NCP students backed by security attacked Darfuri students with bars and machetes at El Ahliya University. 11 injured.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in Kalgi, 35kms southwest of Ed Damazin.
1200 Sudanese Islamists protested outside the UNDP office in Khartoum against the death sentence for Egypts former president Morsi.
Unidentified assailants shoot and kill a soldier in El Fasher.
Cattle herders abducted 13 farmers from Ronga Tas and Haidiya camps in Azum locality.
Rwanda refugee raped by Janjaweed in Tawila.
Three killed in air raid on area north of Fanga.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services; Students (Sudan)
column17: Darfuri students at Omdurman El Ahliya University attacked with metal bars and machetes by NCP student members and security forces. 11 injured.
Two militiamen ambushed Sheikheldin Abu El Kheirat near Tayeba camp in Zalingei. One dead.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF assault IDPs in Dali and Argo camps in North Darfur.
SAF bomb Kauda in Nuba Mountains, dropping two bombs near Kauda Peace Girls Secondary School, killing one child.
Protests in Port Sudan against the demolition of houses in Wala district. Police used tear gas and batons to disperse crowds. 1 injured and taken to hospital. 7 arrested.
Two militiamen ambush a group of 20 women in Kutum. 1 abducted.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF raped three women in area north of Katur.
SAF bomb area near Karkego in East Jebel Marra. 7 killed.
Darfuri students attacked with sticks by NCP students at Kordofan University. 19 wounded.
Hundreds of journalists demonstrated in front of the National Press and Publications Council in Khartoum, in protest of the confiscation of ten newspapers.
SAF bomb Kauda, 2 injured.
SAF bombed Souswa, 25km south of Tawila. No casualties reported.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services; Students (Sudan)
column17: Darfuri students at El Zaeem El Azhari University in Khartoum attacked with metal bars and machetes by NCP student members and security forces. 5 injured.
2 killed in air raid near Fanga.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF shoot 1 man dead in Rahad El Berdi.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF shoot 3 dead in Katila near Nyala, South Darfur.
Perpetrators attack civilians in Otash. One dead, one injured.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services; Students (Sudan)
column17: Darfuri students injured by NISS-backed NCP students at a sit-in, where Darfuri students were protesting against the University of Sudans dismissal of two students from Darfur. NCP assaulted the protesters with machetes and bars.
Dozens protest the closure of Zakat Chamber (Islamic alms) in Gedaref.
Militiaman assaulted a pharmacy worker in Umm Dukhun.
A civilian is dead after an unknown perpetrators attack Abata.
5 militiamen on motorcycles shot at El Mawashi police station in Kabkabia. One attacker shot and killed, 1 policeman wounded.
Janjaweed attack civilians in Taradona and Souswa.
Pro-government militia on motorcycles beat a man in Murnei.
Militiamen shot a man dead in an area north of Nierteti in Central Darfur.
1 killed between Taradona and Khazan Tunjur villages when he picked up an unexploded ordnance.
Janjaweed attack civilians in Mandi and Rahad Shokar.
One is dead in an attack on Kalma.
Janjaweed attack civilians in Taradona and Souswa.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF assault displaced women from Alef camp in Gereda.
Janjaweed attack civilians in Mandi and Rahad Shokar.
Dozens of women in El Kalakla Sangaat district blocked main road to centre of Khartoum in protest of the disruption of water services for more than ten days.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military along road between Shamahaka and Teri village near Kauda. 6 rebels killed, 25 wounded.

Teachers in Gereda go on strike in protest of deduction of salaries. Security briefly detained teachers union chairman. After he was detained and released the same day, new protests were held in anger of the detention.
Unknown gunmen attack Sirba. 1 dead, 5 wounded.
Military use a school in Kadugli to established a base for reserve forces.
Militiamen shot an a soldier dead near Zalingei.
NCP students attacked Darfuri students at Sennar University, using batons, iron bars, and knives. 8 injured, three seriously injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF clash with vehicle hijackers in Nyala. 6 killed, 3 militiamen captured.
Gunmen attacked an UNHCR convoy and abducted 14 Eritrean refugees, on the road between Kassala and Shegarab camps. 6 people injured.
Clashes between soldiers and herdsmen in Masal, 5km north of Khazan Tunjur. 3 wounded.
Armed herders raped 5 women in Umm Bejee, 15km north of Shangil Tobay.
Gunmen raided Dereig camp near Nyala. 1 killed, 4 injured. Another man was shot and killed by gunmen in El Wadi district in Nyala.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: On 6 June 2015, clashes between RSF and vigilante militia in Gereda. 2 RSF militiamen stabbed, 1 vigilante militiaman shot and killed by RSF. 2 others were shot and sustained injury.
Militiaman stabbed a secondary school student in Gereda.
Unidentified gunmen kill a civilian in Shakshaku, Tawila.
Air strikes target SLA forces in Savanga. Causalities not known.
One civilian dead after an attack in Foro Burunga.
Military air forces launch air attacks on Burgo, causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen kill a civilian in Shakshaku, Tawila.
Militiamen injure 3 herdsmen and abduct 4 in area north of Tabit.
Clashes between SPLA-N and military in Kauda.
Clashes between SPLA-N and military in Dirang and Kolgi (Kalgo) areas near Bau in Blue Nile.
Clashes between military and militia north of Tabit. 7 militiamen killed, 3 injured. 3 soldiers wounded.
Clashes between SPLA-N and military in Tiri area of Abu Kershola.
Clashes between SPLA-N and military in Ed Damazin.
Parents of Comboni School students stage a sit-in to protest continued closure of the Catholic school.
SPLM-N take control of army garrison in Maflou, north of Talodi.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLA-AW forces attack government forces at Savanga, Dubo Neita and Golo on 09 Jun. 30 fatalities, 38 injured.
Fur militia attack an unknown actor at an IDP camp. One death reported.
SAF dropped 7 barrel bombs on area west of Rokoro.
Gunmen rape two women in Sharafa.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLA-AW forces attack government forces at Savanga, Dubo Neita and Golo on 09 Jun. 30 fatalities, 38 injured.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLA-AW forces attack government forces at Savanga, Dubo Neita and Golo on 09 Jun. 30 fatalities, 38 injured.
SAF dropped barrel bombs on Tabra, near Tawila.
SAF drop 16 bombs on Solo and Dalo, west of Rokoro. 3 civilians killed.
Fur militia attack an unknown actor at an IDP camp. One death reported. This was the second time there was violence reported in the camp in three days.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in Kalgi, 35kms southwest of Ed Damazin.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military. Rebels capture Maflo area north of Talodi. 2 soldiers killed.

Police kill one rioter in the eastern Khartoum neighbourhood of Al Geraif, where residents gathered to demonstrate against state land expropriation. The crowd had attacked the national police station after burning police property.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military. Rebels capture Wad Abakr for a few hours before withdrawing. 57 soldiers killed.
SAF drop 20 bombs on Wad Abakr. Unknown number of civilians killed.
Pro-government militiamen raped women near Hillet Ahmed Hadi.
Clashes between military and SRF in Wad Abakr in Blue Nile. Unknown number killed.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in Kalgi, 35kms southwest of Ed Damazin. 18 soldiers killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Women beaten and raped by Border Guards in Korma.
Pro-government militiamen raped women in Hillet Ahmed Hadi.
Militiamen attack three displaced people at Um Dafug area near Gereda.
Soldiers attacked by unknown perpetrators in Tha Alba, East Darfur. One dead, five injured.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira; PDF: Popular Defence Forces
column17: Militiamen attacked a convoy of 50 vehicles moving from Tawila to El Fasher. 1 military staff killed, 6 wounded. Convoy included members of army, PDF, and Abu Tira Central Reserve Forces. UNAMID claims three fatalities.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Clashes between RSF and SLM/A-Nur.
SAF bombed Ruvata, Burgo, Dabanara and Taringa, and Surung, killing 14 (5 fatalities coded for Ruvata, 5 for Burgo, and 4 for Taringa). Coordinates for Dabanara and Surung unavailable.
Militiamen on camels and horses opened fire on displaced people in Nabagaya. 1 killed, several wounded.
Militiamen assault displaced people while they were collecting firewood near Kalma camp.
Pro-government militia attack displaced people in Dugma, east of Gereida. 2 wounded.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Clashes between military and SLM/A-Nur in Dalo area north of Fanga and in Dar El Aman north of Rokoro. 19 killed (10 fatalities coded for Fanga, 9 coded for Rokoro).
On 15 June 2015, clash between militiamen and a local rescue team in Shataya. Team had attampted to retrieve a stolen vehicle. 3 killed, 4 wounded.

1 killed, several injured in clashes between Awlad Shibek and Awlad Arafa subsets of Misseriya tribe in Kharasan.
At least two killed and four injured in attack on Samuah village east of Babanussa, at a football club.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Armed group attacked UNAMID peacekeeping soldiers in Anka. One injured, weapons seized.
Body of herder found dead in Muli.
Militia abduct a policeman in Muli.
SAF bombed SPLM-N areas in El Shimi south of Kurmuk. No casualties.
Militiamen injured 2 villagers, abducted three.
SAF bombed SPLM-N areas in Jardan south of Kurmuk. No casualties.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Battle between Sudanese forces and SLM/A-Nur early January around Row Fottah in northeastern Jebel Marrah leaving unidentified number killed. SLM/A-Nur quickly lost its positions around Row Fottah. Sudanese forces reportedly set up a base in Row Fottah and attacked dozens of villages in the area after their victories, leaving at least eight destroyed or severely damaged (Kuloguey, Bougu, Kebkey, Boalah Reih, Boalah Sayed, Orrengah, Jim Sibre, Row Fottah, and Rongatass). Many accounts of civilian deaths (at least 21) and of civilians having suffered physical violence in these attacks. Before they attacked the villages, SAF also shelled the area on several occasions, leaving at least 18 people killed. Intermitent fighting continued between the two groups around Row Fottah through March.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Battle between Sudanese forces and SLM/A-Nur early January around Bourgu in northeastern Jebel Marrah.
Abala herdsmen raid Katur and took hostages to demand payment for dead camels.
Clashes between military and Abala militia in Deleig. At least 1 militia member killed.
Gunmen rape two women in Khazan Tungur.
Militiamen kill a displaced man in Nertiti.

column7: Beni Halba Ethnic Group (Sudan); Masalit Ethnic Group (Sudan); Refugees/IDPs (Sudan)
column16: Al Sudani; Ashorooq; AFP; Radio Dabanga
column17: IDP rioters from Masalit and Beni Halba tribes burn three cars outside government buildings in Geneina claiming that government militia burned down their homes and protesting against general insecurity in the area. Security forces supported by militia opened fire. Reports of 14 killed, including 6 policemen, 27 injured.
Militia kill 2 in Muli.
After attacking civilians in Muli earlier in the day, militia clash with armed group. 6 killed.
Protests against insecurity in Muli.
LRA forces killed a merchant, normally based in the South Darfur town of Songo, during a meeting that took place in the Kafia Kingi enclave.
Militiamen injured two men in Saraf Omra.

Protests after funerals for those killed in riots the day before. Police fired tear gas and shots in the air. 3 killed, 5 taken to hospital suffering the effects of tear gas.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
column17: Military intelligence detained and tortured a man in El Shati area of Sirba.

""Two male Sudanese Red Crescent volunteers were wounded while moving injured civilians to the hospital during fighting between government forces and the displaced in Geneina. They were taken to the hospital in Khartoum and have received treatment with the full expectation that they will fully recover.""
Government employee and policemen at a tax center near Abu Kershola attacked and injured by unknown group.
Sheik abducted from camp in Korgol.
Gunmen injure a girl as she resisted a rape attempt in Donkey El Khair, stabbed her with a knife.
Four gunmen rape two women from Babnusa camp at Safia.
SAF bomb Aradeib. 2 wounded.
SAF shelled areas near Samrah, east of the UNAMID Sortony base. No reported fatality.
Gunmen shoot one dead in Um Baloal, 7km east of El Geneina.

Government fought by air and ground SLMA-Nur forces in Kara, the entrance to Gorolang Banj area in southern Jebel Marra. SLMA-Nur forces were initially defeated but subsequently pushed government forces out of the area on the second day of fighting. The bombs used are believed to have released poisonous chemical smokes in the air, causing many deaths and injuries among civilians. Government forces also looted villages and killed, beat and raped villagers in the course of the fighting. Unknown number of people killed overall.

SAF bombed Elley Fottah southeast of Guldo in January, injuring several persons. The bombs are believed to have released poisonous chemical smokes in the air, causing persistent symptoms to people exposed to them.

Report of numerous ground and air attacks by Sudanese forces on SLM/A-Nur positions near the UNAMID Sortony base throughout January and February, leaving unidentified number killed. After battles, government forces reportedly attacked and looted at least five villages in the area (Barti, Twoywo, and Kurambeing-Elley, Samrah and Sibrah), including three that were partially burned. Many accounts of civilian deaths and of civilians having suffered physical violence in these attacks.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Government forces fought against SLMA-Nur in Kalukidding, the entrance to Tourong-Toara, near Thur in southern Jebel Marrah in mid-January, February, April, late July, and August. Government forces were pushed out of Tourong-Toara by the SLA/AW in late July. Unknown number of people killed in the violence.
SAF bomb Suni, 1 killed.
SAF bomb Lugi, 1 killed.
Militiamen attack Bardi. Three beaten and injured.

Report of air and ground attack by Sudan soldiers supported by Janjaweed militia in Kutrum village near Nertiti, Central Darfur, forcing hundreds of people to flee into the bush for safety. The attackers shot at people and looted and burned down houses in the village. Survivors pointed to several people killed in the air attacks, 10 people killed in the ground attacks, as well as 15 babies who died from starvation and cold while hiding in the bush. The soldiers then clashed with SLA/AW forces outside of the village, leaving unknown number of fatalities.

column17: SLM/A-Nur repulses military caravan attack in Kallih area.
Militiamen attacked and beat displaced families in Kamanga area near Kabkabia.
SAF bombs Barbis in North Darfur on 16, 19 and 22 January. No reported fatality.

Report of additional 15 villages destroyed (Boldon, Darge, Karmal, Katuro, Korgie, Kundah, Kutrum, Kwaniju, Lawey, and Tado) or severely damaged (Barbara, Baringo, Boranga, Keirguei, Rarry, and Teiney Soam) in attacks by pro-government militias on populations seeking to return to their lands east of Nertiti between 15 and 25 January. Many people reportedly experienced severe physical violence and had relatives killed in the attacks. 10 fatalities spread over 4 events on 20 January.

Report of additional 15 villages destroyed (Boldon, Darge, Karmal, Katuro, Korgie, Kundah, Kutrum, Kwaniju, Lawey, and Tado) or severely damaged (Barbara, Baringo, Boranga, Keirguei, Rarry, and Teiney Soam) in attacks by pro-government militias on populations seeking to return to their lands east of Nertiti between 15 and 25 January. column17: Joint military and militia shot 42 people dead in Golo.

Many people reportedly experienced severe physical violence and had relatives killed in the attacks. 10 fatalities spread over 3 events on 20 January.
Displaced man shot and wounded in Dabakwakli near Sibak El Khel camp in Kabkabia.
SAF bombs Barbis in North Darfur on 16, 19 and 22 January. No reported fatality.
SAF bombs Kaninga on 22 January. No known fatality.
SAF shell Thur.
SAF bomb Katerom east of Nertiti. At least 6 killed.
SAF bomb houses east of Golo. 2 killed.
SAF bombs Kotoronek, 60km from Rokoro. Many families fled the area. No casualties reported.
SAF bomb Killing on 23 January, leaving 2 dead and 2 injured.
SAF bombs Kutrum on 23 January, leaving 6 people dead.
SAF shell Thur for second day. Dozens of families flee to Kass.
SAF bomb El Aradeib El Ashara in Tawila locality. No casualties.
Non-violent activity: In afternoon, military fired machine guns mounted on vehicles at areas near Golo. No casualties reported.
SAF continued bombing 4km west of Golo in the morning. No casualties.
SAF bomb 19 villages around Rokoro on Jan 25. No casualties reported.
Committee of Gulf War-affected Persons staged a protest in front of UN office in Khartoum demanding compensations.
3 children killed, 5 wounded in aerial bombardments on Um Gasum near Golo.
SAF bomb Saboon El Fag and Kakor. No casualties.
SAF bomb Kosti. No casualties.
Militiamen kill a gold miner.
SAF bomb Tir Janga, 10km southeast of Golo. 6 killed, 14 wounded.
Security detained 12 anti-dam activists (Kajbar Dam) in Khartoum while protesters held a sit-in.

column6: Mutiny of Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Change to armed group: 1500 South Sudanese/Ngok DInka soldiers in Abyei area, including 20 officers, defect to SPLM-N in Sudan. Defectors accuse government of South Sudan of neglectng issues in Abyei region. Defectors returned to military after one week.
SAF bomb Ullu and Alrom. No casualties.
SAF bomb Malkan. No casualties.
Darfuri students protest against continued SAF bombings in Jebel Marrah. Police arrested three.

Pro-government militiamen attacked Burro village south of Guldo in January or February, beating people with whips. SAF also bombed the area at the same time, forcing dozens of people to flee. The bombs are believed to have released poisonous chemical smokes in the air, injuring many civilians.
Gunmen whip a police officer in Gerida.
SPLM-N clash with military in Kilgo, Blue Nile. 5 rebels wounded. 32 soldiers killed, 13 wounded.
Protests in Wadi Halfa against the building of Kajbar and Dali dams.
Gunmen kill a displaced man in Gerida and beat several others in the market. One woman wounded by a stray bullet.
Security forces allegedly used excessive force to disperse university students who had convened to discuss the attacks on Mouli at El Geneina university.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Unidentified armed group attacked a UNAMID patrol in El Daein, hijacking the vehicle.
Students and UPF affiliates hold demonstration against war in Darfur. Police disperse crowds with tear gas and batons. Several injured but no reports of serious injuries. 3 arrested.
Gunmen on camels wearing military uniforms shot and killed two civilians and raped another girl near Katur.
Traders demonstrate against racism.
SAF bombs Deribat and Kutrum of Darfur on 2 February. No reported fatality.
Security officers allegedly detained and beat a student in a raid on his home in El Geneina. He later died from a head injury.
SAF bombs Deribat and Kutrum of Darfur on 2 February. No reported fatality.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS allegedly beat and arrested a group of 15 women in Khartoum for staging a protest demanding accountability for the 2013 anti-austerity protest killings. Although human rights organisations documented that more than 170 individuals were killed, Sudanese authorities have acknowledged just 85 deaths.
Air raids on Tur. 10 injured over 2 days.
Burned body of Omdurman Hospital medical director found.
SAF bomb Um Beleina near Golo. No casualties.
13 government militia raped 5 women and girls travelling from Baladonek to Tur.
Air raids on Tur. 10 injured over 2 days.
Protests against high market prices and against government policies in Darfur and Blue Nile. 17 women arrested, including a journalist.
Two women who were detained during protests in Khartoum North claim to have been beaten during their detention in Khartoum.
2 students abducted from Konj village, half a kilometre east of Golo.
Salamat militia shot and injured an Abala man in Mukjar market.
SAF bomb Tebay. 1 boy wounded.
Abala militia abduct several Salamat members in retaliation for Abala man being injured.
Armed man attacked 2 girls in Shadad camp, raping one. On same day, two other girls from Shadad camp were raped.
Gunmen kidnap 1 displaced in Daba Naira.
Gunmen kidnap 1 displaced in Saluma.
IDPs protest against attacks on Jebel Marrah.
Government militia attack displaced villagers near Tur in western Jebel Marrah.
Militiamen shot and killed a displaced man attempting to prevent his wife from being raped.
Salamat and Fellata militia clash in Jidad in the week of Feb 8. At least 13 killed.
SPLM-N shell military base in Abri in week of Feb 8.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Military clash with Nur faction; military regains control of Kutrum.

1 abducted in Dobo Umda.

Bombing killed one, injured another 2 km north of Tur.

Nubians protest the construction of Dal and Kajbar dams.

Government forces fought on the ground against SLMA-Nur forces in Sandar Laffa, the entrance to Feina on 14 and 15 February. SLMA-Nuer were initially defeated but subsequently drove the government forces out of the area of Feina the following day. After government forces defeated SLMA-Nuer, they looted, beat and detained people in Feina Market and the adjacent towns of Balley and Tourri - at least 21 people were also killed. Unknown number of fatalities in overall clashes
Militiamen attack and wound 3 IDPs in Siro camp near Nyala.

After government forces defeated SLMA-Nuer, they looted, beat and detained people in Feina Market and the adjacent towns of Balley and Tourri - at least 21 people were also killed. Unknown number of fatalities in overall clashes

SAF bomb Sabat and Lumbry in Dalami County for second day. Several civilians wounded.

Bombings heard from Katronek and Feina areas in southern Jebel Marrah. Government forces also fought on the ground against SLMA-Nur forces in Sandar Laffa, the entrance to Feina on 14 and 15 February.

Government forces were pushed out of Tourong-Toara by the SLA/AW in late July. Unknown number of people killed in the violence.
Report of multiple incidents of beatings and rape by gunmen in military uniforms in Guldo, Central Darfur, between January and February.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Clashes between military and Nur faction in Kutrum. 49 soldiers killed, 19 wounded, 3 Nur rebels killed, 4 wounded. Nur faction recaptured area.

SAF bomb Alabu in Um Dorain county, killing 1, several injured.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Report of numerous ground and air attacks by Sudanese forces on SLM/A-Nur positions near the UNAMID Sortony base throughout January and February, leaving unidentified number killed. After battles, government forces reportedly attacked and looted at least five villages in the area (Barti, Twoywo, and Kurambeing-Elley, Samrah and Sibrah), including three that were partially burned. Many accounts of civilian deaths and of civilians having suffered physical violence in these attacks.

Clashes between military and SPLM-N in Salara on Feb 26 and Umm Sharmut on Feb 27. Rebels claim they killed 53 soldiers, 10 rebels killed over two days (32 fatalities coded for Feb 26, and 31 fatalities coded for Feb 27).

Clashes between military and SPLM-N in Salara on Feb 26 and Umm Sharmut on Feb 27. Rebels claim they killed 53 soldiers, 10 rebels killed over two days (32 fatalities coded for Feb 26, and 31 fatalities coded for Feb 27).

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Non-violent activity: Security officials raided the offices of the Centre for Training and Development TRACKs, detaining several of its staff and affiliates and charging them with a number of offences including crimes against the state, which carry the death penalty. At least three have been detained without charge for 86 days and transferred to Al Huda Prison to await trial, where they remained as of September 2016.

3 women beaten by unknown attackers in Mellit County.

Continued clashes between armed group and police in Bindisi. Military deployed on Apr 8-9. One killed when clashes began on Apr 7. 7 more killed from Apr 8-9, with at least 5 killed on Apr 8 including 2 police, 3 militiamen and 1 displaced child (5 fatalities coded Apr 8, and 2 coded Apr 9).

Continued clasesh between armed group and police in Bindisi. Military deployed on Apr 8-9. One killed when clashes began on Apr 7. 7 more killed from Apr 8-9, with at least 5 killed on Apr 8 including 2 police, 3 militiamen and 1 displaced child (5 fatalities coded Apr 8, and 2 coded Apr 9).

SAF bomb 6 villages east of Guldo. No casualties reported.
SAF bomb Umm Serdiba. 3 children died.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SAF bombed Sarrong targeting SLM/A-Nur soldiers, and attacked the area with ground troops and Janjaweed militia the following day. Government forces claimed to have captured the area, killing 300 rebels and arresting 30. Reports of many civilians also killed in the attacks. In the two weeks that followed the caputure of Sarrong, government forces attacked and looted dozens of villages in the surrounding areas, forcing the entire population of these villages to flee to surrounding mountains. Many were physically assaulted and some killed. Sorrong was destroyed and 19 other villages severely damaged, including Koron, Seri Samm, Lwolanga, Dursa, Jutangah, Kilinge, Deoguey, Bildinje, Twoywo Madille, Burru Wo'o Osman Bakoying-Elley, Wo'o Bahrang-Elley, Wo'o Abu Koada-Elley, Faki Ateeming Soam, Burru Wo'o Issang-Elley, Burro Wo'o Abderamaning-Elley, Burru Wo'o Saidding-Elley, and Jadeed.
SAF bomb Belatuma. No casualties.

column9: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Displaced and students protest against the Darfur referendum. Police and security agents used tear gas and and beat students with batons. 3 arrested. No reports of serious injuries.
SAF bomb Umm Serdiba. No casualties.
Government reportedly beat and detained people who had fled SAF attacks on Sarrong on 10 and 11 April to Golo, suspecting them of being rebels.
At some time between Apr 10-12, SAF bomb Abulila and Hagar-bago in Heiban locality. No casualties.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SAF bombed Sarrong, and attacked the area with ground troops and Janjaweed militia the following day. Government forces claimed to have captured the area, killing 300 rebels and arresting 30. Reports of many civilians also killed in the attacks. In the two weeks that followed the caputure of Sarrong, government forces attacked and looted dozens of villages in the surrounding areas, forcing the entire population of these villages to flee to surrounding mountains. Many were physically assaulted and some killed. Sorrong was destroyed and 19 other villages severely damaged, including Koron, Seri Samm, Lwolanga, Dursa, Jutangah, Kilinge, Deoguey, Bildinje, Twoywo Madille, Burru Wo'o Osman Bakoying-Elley, Wo'o Bahrang-Elley, Wo'o Abu Koada-Elley, Faki Ateeming Soam, Burru Wo'o Issang-Elley, Burro Wo'o Abderamaning-Elley, Burru Wo'o Saidding-Elley, and Jadeed.
8 killed in road ambush by SPLM-N in Abu Kershola.
Displaced from Hamidiya and Khamsa Degaig camps protest against Darfur referendum.
Darfur Students Assn protest plans to move university facilities outside of Khartoum to make way for tourist attractions. Dozens injured as police used tear gas and bullets to disperse them.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Rebels claim to have recaptured Sarrong on Apr 12
Gunmen in military uniforms abduct 5 civilians, including 4 members of Darfur Referendum Commission in Galab.
SAF bomb Tanasa. 4 civilians injured.

column9: NLJM: National Liberation and Justice Movement
column17: NLJM chairman and secretary-general beaten with sticks by NCP members and a soldier at polling centre in El Gubah, Ed Daein, after NLJM alleged rigged voting.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Woman shot and killed and 5 others wounded in Damazin by RSF.
Protesters opposed to Darfur referendum arrested in El Fasher.
Movement of forces: Troops and military aircraft deployed to Ed Damazin.
Several injured in SAF bombing of Lugi in eastern Jebel Marrah.
Militiamen kidnap a shiekh and 2 others in Central Darfur and held for ransom. Released 7 days later after negotiations in Kibro.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS detained 2 demonstrators in Khartoum. Including arrest of artist who drew caricatures about the Darfur referendum. One journalist was detained and beaten.
Gunmen kidnap a Coptic priest in Bielel.
Darfur Students Assn protest plans to move university facilities outside of Khartoum to make way for tourist attractions. Dozens arrested and injured as police used force to disperse them.

SAF dropped a bomb on Nyukur village in Nyukur payam, South Kordofan, leaving one person killed, two children injured, livestock killed, and property destroyed. Right after, SAF dropped another bomb on Sanjak village in Nyukur payam, causing no injuries.
SAF dropped six shells on Tamau and Kulurina villages in Sabat Payam, as well as a bomb in Marada village in Tunguli Payam, Dalami county, South Kordofan. No fatality, injury nor damage.
Gunfight between members of Misseriya and Salamat militia. 2 killed.

SAF dropped a bomb on Nyukur village in Nyukur payam, South Kordofan, leaving one person killed, two children injured, livestock killed, and property destroyed. Right after, SAF dropped another bomb on Sanjak village in Nyukur payam, causing no injuries.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Government forces fought against SLMA-Nur in Kalukidding, the entrance to Tourong-Toara, near Thur in southern Jebel Marrah in mid-January, February, April, late July, and August. Government forces were pushed out of Tourong-Toara by the SLA/AW in late July. Unknown number of people killed in the violence.
In late April, students protest the earlier deaths of two students on other campuses. Also protesting the selling of university land.
In late April, students protest the earlier deaths of two students on other campuses. Also protesting the selling of university land.

In the two weeks that followed the caputure of Sarrong by government forces on 9 April, government forces attacked and looted dozens of villages in the surrounding areas, forcing the entire population of these villages to flee to surrounding mountains. Many were physically assaulted and some killed. Sorrong was destroyed and 19 other villages severely damaged, including Koron, Seri Samm, Lwolanga, Dursa, Jutangah, Kilinge, Deoguey, Bildinje, Twoywo Madille, Burru Wo'o Osman Bakoying-Elley, Wo'o Bahrang-Elley, Wo'o Abu Koada-Elley, Faki Ateeming Soam, Burru Wo'o Issang-Elley, Burro Wo'o Abderamaning-Elley, Burru Wo'o Saidding-Elley, and Jadeed.

In the two weeks that followed the caputure of Sarrong by government forces on 9 April, government forces attacked and looted dozens of villages in the surrounding areas, forcing the entire population of these villages to flee to surrounding mountains. Many were physically assaulted and some killed. Sorrong was destroyed and 19 other villages severely damaged, including Koron, Seri Samm, Lwolanga, Dursa, Jutangah, Kilinge, Deoguey, Bildinje, Twoywo Madille, Burru Wo'o Osman Bakoying-Elley, Wo'o Bahrang-Elley, Wo'o Abu Koada-Elley, Faki Ateeming Soam, Burru Wo'o Issang-Elley, Burro Wo'o Abderamaning-Elley, Burru Wo'o Saidding-Elley, and Jadeed.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Report of intermittent fighting between Sudanese and SLM/A-Nur forces around Kaguro between February and June, after Sudanese forces captured their bases early January.
Militiamen shell Kambo Tambo, 3 kms south of Sorenti camp in Kabkabia. Homes burned. No casualties.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS agents beat several people protesting against road closures.
Militia injure man and rape two women between Lewi and Nertiti.
SPLM-N shoot down a military helicopter and carry out ground attacks between Alatmur and Al Nogra. SPLM-N claim to have killed 85 soldiers and lost 5 rebels.

column16: Radio Tamazuj; Xinhua; AFP; Radio Dabanga
column17: Clashes between SLM defectors that make up Al-Savanna group of Rizaygat militia vs. Arab Maaliya militia in Khor Taan area of Yassin locality, supposedly over cattle rustling. Military intervened. At least 21 killed, including 9 soldiers and a commander of Al-Savanna.

column16: AFP; Radio Tamazuj; Xinhua; Radio Dabanga
column17: Clashes between SLM defectors that make up Al-Savanna group of Rizaygat militia vs. Arab Maaliya militia in Khor Taan area of Yassin locality, supposedly over cattle rustling. Military intervened. 12 tribal fighters are killed along with 9 soldiers who intervene to stop the battle.

Al-Savanna Rizaygat attack home of East Darfur governor. Governor was not present. Guards exchanged fire with armed group. At least 4 security guards and 2 civilians killed, supposedly in retaliation of the killing of an Al-Savanna commander during clashes earlier that day.

18 killed in clashes between Jamainiya and Sabeh clans of the Hamar tribe, over cattle rustling disputes in Shagel Jamainiya area of El Nahud locality in West Kordofan (coordinates for Kordofan capital El Obeid used).
Militiaman beat a displaced man with sticks near Shanga in South Darfur.
Student strike and hold sit-ins in Khartoum following police violence and arrests at protests the week prior. Several arrested during the sit-tin.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF rape a girl near Salam camp.
A displaced man killed, another wounded by militiamen in camp south of Sortony in Kabkabia. Militiamen also raped displaced women collecting firewood south of Sortony on the same day.
Clashes between military and SPLM-N in Alrom (Blue Nile capital Ed Damazin used). 43 soldiers killed, 7 rebels killed. 3 soldiers captured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Looting: RSF looted livestock from Tajura village in Kumbur payam, South Kordofan, driving them to Amdual village in Talodi county controlled by government troops. Evidence of looting of villages and indiscriminate attacks targeting civilians in the course of previous such lootings by government forces.
PCP students attack UPF students in Omdurman.
Militiamen on camels ambush a commercial vehicle in Bulbul and injure the driver.
Police used tear gas and water cannons and beat students protesting against Darfur referendum in El Sug El Arabi neighbourhood in Khartoum.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services; Students (Sudan)
column9: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019); USO: United Students Opposition
column17: A USO student was shot and killed by NCP student rioters at the University of Kordofan in El Obeid, in lead-up to student council elections. NCP students used pistols, stones and stick to injure other students; they also destroyed vehicles and broke down a school wall. 40 students injured, at least 20 arrested. The attack allegedly began when the NISS intercepted a group of students marching peacefully towards the Student Union to submit a list of pro-opposition candidates, firing into the crowd.
Militiamen shot and killed a displaced man near Salam camp.
Militiamen shoot and kill a student in Zamzam
Movement of forces: Army and police troops deployed to Ed Daein after attack on East Darfur governors house Apr 17.
Student protests against the killing of a student during protests earlier in the week.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Student protests against the killing of a student during protests earlier in the week. Police and NISS used batons and tear gas to break up protesters. One student seriously injured.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Students strike against government plan to move faculties outside the city. Protesters also demanded the release of students detained during demonstrations over the prior week and protest against the killing of a student during protests Apr 19. NISS beat several protesters and detained several.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Clashes between RSF and SLM in Birmazza. 10 RSF killed including a commander.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Clashes between military and RSF vs. SLM in Wadi Magreb, Kutum. 20 soldiers and RSF killed over 2 days of fighting.
Student protests against the killing of a student during protests earlier in the week.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Second day of clashes between military and RSF vs. SLM in Wadi Magreb, Kutum. 20 soldiers and RSF killed over 2 days of fighting.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Looting: RSF looted livestock from Umdurdu Konjani village in Kumbur payam, South Kordofan. Evidence of looting of villages and indiscriminate attacks targeting civilians in the course of previous such lootings by government forces.
Girl raped and abducted by militiamen in Katur.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Security agents and NCP students attack Darfur students who were protesting a policy on the release of exam results as well as the sale of university land. Several wounded, 23 arrested.
Clashes between military and SPLM-N in Lima, west of Kadugli. Unknown number of soldiers killed. Rebels lost 4 fighters. 14 fatalities coded in total.
Students protest the arrest of students during earlier protests.
SRF declared unilateral cessation of hostilities for 6 months, effective Apr 24.
Students protest killing of student last week.
Displaced girl raped and left in a coma in Bir Saleeba.
For second day in Shendi, students protest killing of student last week.
Abala militia kidnap 2 from Kalma camp, demanding ransom.

A government warplane bombed a leading primary school in Kauda, Sudan, wounding a Kenyan teacher. The Sudan Sukhoi jet dropped two parachute bombs into the compound of the St. Vincent Primary School at the Diocese of El Obeid, damaging classrooms and library
SAF bomb Umm Serdiba. No casualties.
Protests against killing of 2 students in IDP camp.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Port Sudan student protest killing of student last week in Kordofan. Security agents forcibly confronted students, causing injuries. No reports of serious injuries.
Students protest the killing of a student at the University of Kordofan the week before.
1 killed, 1 injured by cattle raiders in Wang Thou in Abyei.
SAF bomb areas of Jebel Marrah. 2 injured.
4 women raped and beaten with rifle butts in Tabit.
Militiamen shoot and seriously wound a student in Tawila.
Militiamen shoot 2 dead in Deieiga IDP camp.
13 women attacked by militiamen in Tabit.
Policeman stabbed 12 km northeast of El Geneina, died next day.
SAF bomb al-Ketira in Abu Jubaiha. No casualties.
Students at Omdurman Islamic University hold a sit-in to protest violence at Kordofan university earlier.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF abduct a displaced man at gunpoint in Kabkabia.
Students in Sennar hold a sit-in to protest violence at Kordofan university earlier.
Students riot and throw stones against plan to sell university land as well as the prior arrests of students. Police fired tear gas and used batons. No reports of serious injuries.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Students in Nyala protest bus fare rise. Security agents fired live bullets and tear gas. Many injured and taken to hospital. Police and RSF arrest more than 50 students.
SAF bomb Heiban. No casualties.
SAF bomb Mara. No casualties.
SAF bomb Nyakma and Auru. No casualties.
SAF bomb Hagar. No casualties.
SAF bomb Kodi, Buri, Wadi Toro, and Baga in Jebel Marrah. No casualties confirmed.
Armed group fired RPGs at house of the governor of East Darfur, landed on a neighbouring house and killed 2 civilians, injured 4.

column8: UJEM: United Justice and Equality Movement
column17: Change to armed group: Group of field commanders declared split from JEM and establishment of new movement called the United Justice and Equality Movement.
An armed Ngok Dinka shot dead a Ngok Dinka man in Abyei town.
Gunmen fire on displaced children in Abyed camp in Gereida.
Displaced woman and daughter abducted near Sortony camp.
Protests in Khartoum following news of student killed in Omdurman. 5 protesters of Darfur Students Assn arrested.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: 12 Red Sea University student protesters arrested in Jabet, dozens injured when security forces broke up demonstrations.
Nyala students protest bus fares for third day in a row.
Clashes between military and SPLM-N in Umm Serdiba. 6 rebels killed, 18 wounded. Unknown number of soldiers killed. 16 fatalities coded in total.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column9: ANMS: Association of Nuba Mountains Students; Students (Sudan)
column16: ProtectDefenders.eu; Radio Tamazuj; AFP; Radio Dabanga
column17: NCP forces backed by security agents shot at students during Nuba Students Association rally at Ahlia University in Omdurman. 1 student killed, 3 injured.

column9: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Student protests in Port Sudan. Security and police used tear gas, no reports of serious injuries.
Clashes between student rioters and police at Khartoum University.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between RSF and police in Nyala. 2 civilian bystanders wounded.
Gunmen kill trader in El Geer district of Nyala.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Security agents used batons and tear gas and beat student protesters at Quran University in Omdurman. 6 arrested, many injured.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Bahri University students protest against student killing earlier in Omdurman. Riot police and security agents used force to disperse crowds.
SPLM-N shoot down an SAF Antonov that had been reportedly bombing areas of South Kordofan. SPLM-N hit plane near El Obied airport and it crash landed at airport. 5 officers killed.
Gunmen from Abala tribe on camels wound 6 in Kalma camp. Police deployed to area.
SAF bombing areas of South Kordofan. No casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF abduct a displaced man from Kabkabia market. They beat him with rifles and took him to an unknown destination. Second such occurrence in Kabkabia in one week.
Military and militia attack and rape civilians on road between Suni and Deribat. 2 killed over three days (1 fatality coded for Apr 30 and 1 fataity for May 1).

Government air raids on El Azrag, between late March and early April, caused civilian injuries. Some victims became paralysed, had blurred vision, vomiting, or diarrhoea, which could be the result of exposure to insecticides and herbicides, or nerve agents.
Clashes between military and SPLM-N near Suni near Jebel Marrah.
Military and militia attack and rape civilians on road between Suni and Deribat. 2 killed over three days (1 fatality coded for Apr 30 and 1 fatality for May 1).
Gunmen fire on displaced group in Sortony, wounding one.
SAF bomb Heiban. 6 children were killed as well as a woman in neary Kwarly village as she hid to escape the bombs. 1 person was injured, and significant material damage was reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
column17: Military intelligence torture and burn to death a member of the Ingessana tribe in Blue Nile State in week of May 2; he had been arrested 6 months earlier.
SAF bomb Kauda. No casualties.
SAF dropped eight bombs on Heiban for the second day. Two women were injured and livestock killed.
Military and militia attack and rape civilians on road between Suni and Deribat. 2 killed over three days (1 fatality coded for Apr 30 and 1 fatality for May 1).
Displaced woman shot dead and others beaten in Sali Sala 15km west of Zamzam camp.
SAF bomb Hajar-Bago and Urru. No casualties yet reported.
SAF dropped two bombs on Hy-Almatar village, Eldo locality of Kauda. No casualty reported.

column9: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Students demand the release of detainees and restoration of students union. Police and security agents used tear gas and stun grenades and rubber bullets, resulting in injury to dozens of students. Several arrested. No reports of serious injuries.
Militiamen shoot and rob civilians on road between Kukul and Saraf Omra.
SAF bomb Heiban for third day. No casualties yet reported for May 3.
Armed militiamen rape two displaced girls in Keira.
Unknown gunmen attacked and killed a Ngok Dinka on his way from the Noong common market to central Abyei, stealing his motorcycle.
SAF dropped eight bombs on Heiban. No casualties nor damage reported.
Militia kill 2 and injure 1 in Guldo.
Students demonstrate against arrival of medical team in Murnei. Police used tear gas and gunfire. 3 injured, no reports of serious injuries.
SAF bombs Kutrum. 3 injured.
2 killed when unexploded ordnance detonated at El Aradieba El Ashara.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Security agents broke into human rights office while lawyer was meeting with clients regarding dismissal of protesting students. Agents beat office staff and students, and arrested several of them.
SAF dropped four bombs on Kobang village, Heiban locality. No casualties nor damage reported.
SAF dropped four bombs on Yabus Kobri and Yabus Gaba villages, Yabus locality.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Looting: Suspected SLM/A-Nur forces raided areas where Rizaygat people lived near the UNAMID Sortony camp. This incident urged Rizaygat militias to raid the camp in the days that followed.

column9: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-); Women (Sudan)
column17: Militia rape girl in Terra El Madrasa, 5kms west of Tawila. UNAMID peacekeepers later arrested 3 suspects.
Clashes between two unknown militia in Um Lawta area 7kms northwest of Kabkabia. 3 killed, 2 injured.
Militiamen beat people in Tabit.
One farmer shot dead by militiamen in Wadi Badiab north of Nertiti.
Militiamen rape and beat 3 girls in Dawa near Tabit.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services; Students (Sudan)
column17: Student rioters backed by security agents torch campus mosque, protesting against expulsion. Rioters beat other students with sticks and machetes.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Students strike at the University of Imam El Mahdi in Kosti. NISS and police used tear gas and beat protesters, seriously injuring 5 students and detaining dozens of others.
Looting: Militiamen raid cattle and then fire shots into the air in Tabit.
Eight people killed in attacks by pro-government militias on displaced populations around the UNAMID Sortoni base.
Militiamen kidnap 2 displaced from Karkara market.
Militiamen abduct 2 women in Mashrou Abu Zeid near Jabal Marrah.
SAF fired eight rockets on Kodira village, Tangal locality, from the Alatmor area in the western part of the county, killing two men and livestock.
SAF dropped five bombs on Chali and Be villages, Chali Alfeel locality.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services; Students (Sudan)
column17: For second day, student rioters backed by security agents protesting against expulsion, beat other students with sticks and machetes.
Gunmen, allegedly SPLM-N, attacked camel herders from the Maaliya tribe, 3kms from Farshaya.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Looting: NISS raid the homes and arrest parents of students who participated in riots at the school the prior week.

column9: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-); Refugees/IDPs (Sudan); Women (Sudan)
column16: Radio Dabanga; Sudan Tribune; UNAMID; Amnesty International
column17: Following earlier clashes at the market, unknown group attacked Sortony camp, targeting civilians. At least 6 killed in two attacks (3 killed in clashes earlier at market 300m from Sortony, 3 killed inside camp later in the day), several wounded including a UNAMID peacekeeper from the nearby base. 2 attackers arrested by UNAMID. Reports that militiamen also raped two women and abducted 2 others during the attacks.
Clash between military and Rizaygat militia in Umm Gonga in Assalaya. 3 soldiers killed.
A Misseriya cattle herder was stabbed to death in a fight with another Misseriya cattle herder near Tajalei, southern Abyei.
Clashes between military and SPLM-N in Angarto northeast of Talodi. SPLM-N claim to have killed 32 soldiers, wounded 100. 1 rebel killed, 18 wounded.
SAF dropped two bombs on Sinnar village, Kumbar locality, killing livestock.
SPLM-N claim to have repulsed military attack in Tembera and Undurdu in Nuba Mountains.
Militiamen intercept a water tanker en route from Sortony to Kabkabia and abduct 3 camp residents traveling on board.
Militiaman rape two women in Tarny.
A Sudanese Coptic priest is abducted by three gunmen in a landcruiser in Nyala
1 policeman killed, 1 injured by gunmen in attack on station in Radom. Gunmen suspected to be relatives of a person who was arrested by police for robbery.
SAF dropped three bombs on Mandi village, Kumbar locality, killing livestock.
SAF dropped seven bombs on Hajar Madani village, Heiban locality. No damage reported.
SAF soldiers attacked Reka village, Reka locality, killing a man and looting livestock.
SAF dropped 12 bombs on Chali village, Chali Alfeel Payam, destroying homes.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SPLM-N repulse an attack by the military, leaving 6 soldiers dead.
Militiamen attack and sexually assault girls in Tabit.
SPLM-N kill three soldiers attempting to loot civilian cattle in Kujuria.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: A British journalist and his Darfur translator were abducted by RSF members in Darfur while investigating reports of chemical use against civilians in Jebel Marra between January and August 2016 by Amnesty International. They were detained and allegedly tortured for two months first in North Darfur and then at Kober prison in Khartoum.
A bombing campaign by the Sudanese Airforce results in two civilian deaths.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Report of intermittent fighting between Sudanese and SLM/A-Nur forces around Kaguro between February and June, after Sudanese forces captured their bases early January.
Gunmen abduct a tribal leader and 2 others between Saraf Omra and Karnoi in June.
Gunmen abduct and sexually assault a girl while stealing cattle.
Students clash with NCP-alligned students clash over student union elections.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Five students of the University of the Holy Koran in the twin city of Khartoum were wounded in a shooting that involved NISS agents and NCP students. The disagreement began when NCP students objected tothe candidate list for the union elections. Two of the wounded are in serious condition. NCP students also violently attack university professors and staff during clashes over student elections.

Traders at the Grand Market of Nyala, capital of South Darfur, closed their shops on Monday and gathered in front of the office of the Commissioner of Nyala to protest against the trial and fines imposed on some traders by the public order court because of expired goods.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: A butcher is abducted by members of the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) militia on Monday, he refused to pay compensation for agricultural crops
SAF drop 17 bombs on Lower and Upper Kauda, injuring three people.
SAF dropped 12 bombs on Yabus Kobri village, Yabus locality, killing two people and injuring another three.
Clashes continue for a second day between NCP and PCP aligned students.
At least 37 people were killed in inter-communal clashes between the Sabeh and Jamainiya clans from Al-Hammer tribe in Sudan's West Kordofan.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Agreement: Senior political and military leaders of Abdul-Wahid movement announced their split from the movement and their decision to join the peace process in the state.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SPLM-N ambush a Sudanese military mobile unit between Khordileb and Al Azrak, killing over 50 soldiers.
Strike:El Jareeda journalists went on strike for two days in protest of the continued seizure of copies by the Sudanese security service (NISS).
Seven people kidnapped in Al Kereinik by militiamen.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: A number of displaced people from a camp in Gireida locality, South Darfur, were kidnapped by the RSF.
Police use live bullets to disperse rioters protesting against the confiscation of charcoal plants owned by local residents. One demonstrator is hospitalised and later dies.
Pro-government militiamen kidnap a North Darfur policeman from his home.

Two militiamen riding motorcycles attacked the prospector while he was looking for gold north of camp Kassab. They shot him in the abdomen and shoulder before robbing him. The victim later died of his injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Rapid Support Forces (RSF) militia attacked two army personnel while they were guarding Looni forest in Abu Hujar locality in Sinnar state. The militiamen stripped the soldiers of their weapons and took them to their headquarters in the area.
Violent demonstrations against the removal of an artisanal brick factor for a second day. Demonstrators clash with police who use tear gas.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS officers raided the home of a Darfurian activist in El-Shahinat neighborhood of Khartoum, forcing entry and firing shots in the air before arresting the activist. After 45 days of detention in Jebel Awlia and Bahri Mohaf Shandi, the activist was charged with criminal conspiracy, undermining the constitutional system and waging war against the state by the Office of the Prosecutor for State Security. His arrest followed his participation in the funeral of a student killed by NISS in Omdurman Ahlia university. The activist was severely beaten in detention and had his employment terminated following NISS threats to his employer. He was released three months later.

A group pro-government militiamen tried to prevent nearly 1,000 people from tilling their lands at Sigilli gate south of Tawila in North Darfur. When the farmers refused to leave, the militiamen attacked and injured an armed PDF militiaman guarding the farmers.

Sudanese police used tear gas for a third consecutive day on Saturday to disperse violent demonstrators who protest plans to remove artisanal brick factory in Al-Geraif-Sharg suburb of Khartoum State.
SAF dropped four bombs on Lowere and South Kolo villages in Eldo Payam. No damage reported.

Abala tribesman enter Azerni camp mosque and kill 9 people. Eight are killed instantly while one dies in hospital later. The attack was revenge for an earlier killing of an Abala tribesman by an IDP after the tribesman refused to pay the IDP for transporting his goods.
SAF dropped two bombs on Chawri village, Dabi locality, Heiban county. Six children were killed in aerial bombardements in Heiban county on the same day.
SAF dropped four bombs on Lowere and South Kolo villages in Eldo locality. No damage reported.
A Sudanese soldier is killed after pursuing Abala tribesman responsible for killing 9 IDPs
Unknown group abducts 8 people from Fanga and kept hostage in Tarny. One reportedly tortured to death. 6 were released.
SAF dropped a bomb on Lowere village. No damage reported.
Refugees from Azerni camp march to El Geina carrying the bodies of IDPs killed by Abala tribesmen to protest against insecurity.
