SAF dropped five bombs on Heiban during the memorial service for six children killed the day before in the county by aerial bombardment, killing a baby and injuring another six children.
SAF dropped six bombs on Nyakima village in Alazrag locality. Three houses and a hut were destroyed.
Looting: Armed Abala tribesmen attacked a village east of Azerni and stole 50 sheep and three horses. No report of casualties.
A secondary school student is kidnapped by gunmen in the North Darfur gold mining area of Abdul Shakoor in Kutum.

A number of lawyers on Wednesday organized protests in front of the Bar Association in Khartoum protesting the storming of the office of a laywer by security personnel and the arrest of a number of university students. Security dispersed the protest and ripped down their banners and arrested lawyer Mohammed Hassan Mohammed.
An Antonov dropped 12 bombs on the Umm Serdiba near to Umm Dorain. No casualties reported.

Militiamen on camels and horses opened fire on a group of farmers camping at Tullus, southwest Murnei. Three of the farmers, including a woman, were transferred to El Geneina hospital in serious condition.
The Sharwa area of Heiban locality is bombed by the SAF. No casualties reported.
Armed men abducted 7 in Fanga.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF militiamen seize a vehicle that was loaded with goods. They also abduct six passengers to an unknown destination.
Militamen abduct a girl from Sinja, rape her, and release her two days later.
1 soldier shot dead in clash with cattle raiders outside Tawila.
A Sudanese Air Force Antonov dropped ten barrel bombs on the Uru area, southeast of Heiban. No casualties reported.
9 displaced women arrested for protesting in front of police station; protesting for release of a woman who was evicted and arrested.
Sparked by an SAF air strike in Guru near Heiban earlier in the day, military and SPLM-N ground clashes for 4-5 hours.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF beat a man and rape two girls in Hai Aluda, Sinja.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM-AW claim to have seized control of Katrom in western Jabal Marrah, killing 72 soldiers and militiamen. 5 rebels killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: SPLM-N claim to have clashed with RSF in Torda near Kilgo in Bau County, after the government dispatched hundreds of RSF troops to the area. Unknown number of casualties.
1 bomb dropped on Chado (Chawde). No casualties.
2 bombs dropped on Kumo. No casualties.
3 bombs dropped on Lowere, killing livestock and burning down infrastructure.
SAF bombed Kambara village, Heiban locality. One girl was injured, huts were destroyed and livestock was killed.
Cattle raiders shoot a woman dead in Simba, northwest of Mershing.
Unknown militia shoot dead an imam in Radom in South Darfur.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: At least 2 students detained during Darfuri students association march in El Sug El Arabi to downtown Khartoum. Another protest occurred in Khartoum on the same day in front of Ministry of Justice; NISS used batons to disperse the crowd. No reports of serious injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF kidnapped a man from Kass market.
SAF dropped five bombs on Hajar Bago village in Alazrag Payam, Heiban county, South Kordofan. No reported casualty.
Militiamen attacked displaced women 10km south of Tabit, beating them with rifle butts and whips.
Military and SPLM-N clash in Kilgo on June 1.

Three Janjaweed militiamen attacked and raped a displaced woman at gunpoint inside her farm situated in Wadi Karkor, located north-west of Hesahesa IDP camp. The victim was taken to the hospital by her relatives, where she received treatment.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Prison Guards
column17: Non-violent activity: Militiamen attacked a prison in Safar Omra, and intimidated the guards into freeing all prisoners.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column16: Xinhua; Sudan Tribune; Al Ra'y alAam
column17: Military supported by border guards recapture Jebel Kilgo after clashes with SPLM-N on the road near the city. 100 rebels arrested. Unknown number killed.
One child injured when children of a Koranic school found several RPGs and one exploded in Halanga area of Khor Shallal.
SAF bomb a mosque east of Nertiti, killing 2 people. 7 injured.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Clashes between military and SPLM-N 10kms northeast of Al-Azraq. 25 soldiers killed. 1 rebel killed.
SAF bombs villages in Nertiti, Central Darfur. 6 killed and 18 injured.
Four unknown militiamen dressed in military uniform looted a vehicle belonging to the Ministry of Education in Zalingei after killing a policeman and threatening the driver.
Looting: Cattle raiders fire in the vicinity of livestock owners before stealing cattle in Fanga.

Unknown paramilitary force attack army water tanker in Shag el Nakhara, Kutum. 3 military staff killed, 3 injured. 1 militiamen killed. Soldiers pursued gunmen until Damrat Dawa south of Kutum but did not make arrests.
SAF bomb Fanga. No casualties.
Sit-in held to demand release of detained students.
Gunmen rape two girls in Timro in Jebel Marrah.

column7: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: UNAMID employees protest over non-payment of dues.
Gunmen abducted a man from Bindisi.
Heavy clashes and shelling between military and SPLM-N in Al Azraq.
SAF bomb Fulujah, Tamra and Talba. No casualties.
Militiamen gathered at Kutum threatening to attack the market. Exchanged fire with soldiers. Several gunmen arrested.
Unknown group open fire on a bus, seriously injuring 2.
Heavy clashes and shelling between military and SPLM-N in Al Azraq.
Agreement: Rizaygat and Misseriya ethnic militia sign a peace agreement in Bielel.
Alleged aerial bombardment by SAF on Nertiti area left 6 people killed and 18 injured.
Two unknown gunmen on a motorcycle shot and killed two men and seriously wounded another when they fired at a vehicle moving from Noong towards Abyei.
Families of detained students stage a sit-in at NISS offices and around in Khartoum.
Army troops beat prosecutors with sticks in Ed Daein market.
Militiamen on camels and horses beat and whip displaced people in Tullus, Shamra and Turr. 8 injured total.
Residents of Kalalka south of Khartoum riot against power cuts and water supply, burn tires and blocked roads.

Three members of the Sudanese Armed Forces shot a trader inside his shop in Demazin. Youssef Mohamed Bashir, aged 40, was attacked and his shop looted. The soldiers looted a large amount of money and a mobile phone. When the trader sought to resist them he received three bullet wounds to the abdomen.
SAF dropped six bombs in Jimaizay village, in Alazrag Payam, Heiban county, South Kordofan, destroying two huts and killing livestock.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Prison Guards
column17: 10 prisoners escape from Ed Daein. The prison guards managed to stop two of them after shooting and wounding them.
State prosecution offices close in protest of army troops beating prosecutors the day before.
Militiamen stab a man to death in Murnei camp.
Police officers shoot two civilians for refusing to come with them to investigate stolen weapons. No fatalities.
Two children were killed and two others injured by an UXO in Agab village, Andulu Payam, Umdorein County in South Kordofan.
Police and military attack El Jebel market in Nyala, beating them with rifle butts and sticks. Several taken to hospital.

column9: Dinka Ngok Ethnic Group (Sudan); Government of Sudan (1989-2019)
column17: An armed Ngok Dinka attacked three Ngok Dinka community protection committee members for unknown reasons in the area of Agok in Abyei, killing two and seriously injuring one. The assailant later killed himself.

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Police and security dressed in plain clothes dispersed dozens of families of detainees who gathered outside of NISS in Khartoum.

column9: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Police raid market, assaulting merchants in Nyala for second day. State security intervened to contain violence.
A child was killed and another was injured when a UXO exploded in Umserndiba village, Tangal Payam, Umdorein county in South Kordofan.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Residents heard gunfire in Hay al Jebel. Police reportedly clashed with RSF.
A child was injured when a UXO exploded in Toldong village, Andulu Payam, Umdorein county in South Kordofan.
SAF dropped eight bombs in Magar and Jiro villages, Wadaka Payam in Blue Nile, injuring one man.
SAF dropped eight bombs in Magar and Jiro villages, Wadaka Payam in Blue Nile, injuring one man.
Armed group attack Hamidiya camp and opened fire, 1 wounded and 2 abducted.

A number of Janjaweed riding aboard 4X4 vehicles armed with Dushka heavy machine guns raped two displaced women as they collected firewood in Jebel Kajwa, situated 14km north of Zalingei. The victims were from Hameida IDP camp and were aged 22 and 26, respectively.

Four Janjaweed militiamen dressed in military uniform abducted Adam Ahmed Saror, a local merchant in Zalingei's main market, from his shop before driving away. Fortunately the merchant was later rescued by the police with additional assistance.
SAF dropped four bombs on a farm in Soda village, Shali Payam in Blue Nile, leaving all crops were destroyed but without causing human casualties.
SAF abducted three people working on their farms in Oli village, Alazrag Payam, taking them to an unknown destination.
Looting: Cattle raiders fire into the air and steal livestock from Um Traiter, 6kms south of Tabit. No casualties.
Air raids on Gandolo village in Yabus payam, Blue Nile. No casualties.
Three people were seriously injured when a UXO exploded while they were working on their land in Ekvwarting farms, on the way to Agab village, Andulu Payam, Umdorein county in South Kordofan.
Pro-government militia clashed and exchanged fire with police and government troops in Zalingei, after police arrested a militiamen accused of theft.

""Armed men carjacked a UN-contracted truck with three drivers in the Azoum area of Um Shalaiya. One of the drivers was released after negotiations. on June 27, 2016, in El Geneina, West Darfur. Another driver managed to escape during the ambush and the perpetrators released the second shortly after the abduction.""

Seven Janjaweed militiamen riding on the back of camels and dressed in military uniform killed two shepherds and looted 64 heads of cattle. The incident took place in Dabah Nairah, situated 47km from Zalingei.
SAF dropped six bombs in Samary village, Wadaka Payam in Blue Nile, killing two goats.
SLM-MM reported that unknown militiamen attacked and killed 3 civilians in Kamu in the week of June 13.
2 children killed, 2 injured while playing with an unexploded ordance in El Riyadh, Easy Darfur near Ed Daein.
Clashes between military and SPLM-N in Maradis. 24 rebels taken to hospital.
Militiamen in military uniforms opened fire and seriously wounded farmers in Mole south of El Geneina.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Report of intermittent fighting between Sudanese and SLM/A-Nur forces around Kaguro between February and June, after Sudanese forces captured their bases early January.
In June, gunmen on camels clashed with cattle raiders outside Tawila. 1 security officer shot dead during clashes.
Sit-ins to protest power outages.
7 displaced farmers abducted by militiamen in Jabour area, 10km west of Gereida.
Clash between PDF and paramilitary group in Um Burma, 7km east of Tawila. PDF member injured.

SPLM-N forces killed Youssef Abu Hayat Mohamed, a local farmer in Bik village. The victim was killed with a knife inside his home. A local witness stated that he was killed for refusing to stop working on his farmland.
Militants attack Beni Hussein police station in Sereif, attempting to free detainees. In firefight, police shot dead two attackers. 4 police wounded.
Residents of Adeed El Ureifia in Bara locality rioted over land allocation, assaulting policemen who were accompany their protest. 21 arrested.

Two pro-government militiamen attacked two displaced girls as they were collecting firewood north of Aamar Jadid village. One girl was able to escape, though the other, a 16 year-old Tunjur, was caught, tied up and taken to north El Jebel where she was raped and left in the valley.

Four Janjaweed militiamen dressed in military uniform and riding aboard a 4x4 vehicle attacked a displaced man by the name of Hussein Mohamed Nandi in his farm situated in Um Bronga village, causing serious harm.
Bashir declares unilateral 4-month ceasefire in Blue Nile and South Kordofan States.
Bashir declares unilateral 4-month ceasefire in Blue Nile and South Kordofan States.
Cattle raiders fire on civiians, injuring one.
Agreement: Rizaygat and Habbaniyah sign peace agreement in Buram.
Pro-government militiamen attacked Kindi village, situated in north-east Buram. During the attack four civilians were killed.
2 killed in air raid.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Unknown armed group kill 1 and injure 2 displaced in Otash camp.
Unknown gunmen attack Thur camp, killing 4, injuring 7. Separate event from Abala militia attacking village of Tur on same day.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Unidentified gunmen kill NISS officer.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese army attempted to capture Kwila from SLM/A, near Nertiti in Central Darfur. SLA/AW retaliated with an attack against an army base in Boldon, Central Darfur. No mentioned fatalities.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Rapid Support Force militiamen numbering 15 attacked and looted three houses in El-Mataar neighbourhood of Nyala. During the assault one person was severely injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: On the 20th June, a combined force consisting of the Rapid Support Forces and Janjaweed militias attacked the village of Tor situated in west Jebel Marra, just 14km south of Nertiti. The combined troops arrived on a large number of 4x4 vehicles and motorcycles. During the assault they looted the market and civilian homes before setting them on fire. Following the withdrawal of the attacking forces, monitors were able to record the death of five civilians, the serious injury of three civilians, and the unknown whereabouts of seven persons who either fled or were abducted

Three pro-government militiamen attacked and shot dead a civilian for reasons that are currently unknown. The body was taken to the mortuary in Nyala Teaching Hospital, though thus far the identity of the dead civilian is still unknown. The deceased continued to maintain all of their possessions after the shooting.

Twelve pro-government militiamen riding three camels, three horses and six motorcycles opened fire on a commercial vehicle ferrying 35 passengers from Nyala to Mukjar. Upon forcing the vehicle to stop, the militiamen beat the passengers with sticks and whips before looting their possessions.
Militia on camels attacked Kenjarh area in East Jebel Marrah. 2 injured.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese army attempted to capture Kwila from SLM/A, near Nertiti in Central Darfur. SLA/AW retaliated with an attack against an army base in Boldon, Central Darfur. No mentioned fatalities.
Armed forces reportedly recapture large areas of South Kordofan, as they approached the outskirts of Kauda.

Unknown gunmen opened fire on a commercial pickup vehicle in Kolom area transporting traders from Warrap State, South Sudan, to the common market at Noong, Abyei, killing three and wounding two seriously. The gunmen also exchanged fire with a UNISFA patrol responding to the incident, which later arrested two suspects.

column8: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
column17: Unknown gunmen opened fire on a commercial pickup vehicle in Kolom area transporting traders from Warrap State, South Sudan, to the common market at Noong, Abyei, killing three and wounding two seriously. The gunmen also exchanged fire with a UNISFA patrol responding to the incident, which later arrested two suspects.

Gunmen in military uniform and suspected to be soldiers beat a trader with whom they had a disagreement about a purchase. A police officer intervened and he was also beaten (though not targeted) by soldiers.

Abala militia attack Tur over two days. 5 killed, 8 wounded on June 20. At least several injured on June 21. Supposedly in retaliation for army stealing livestock or because an Abala herder supposedly killed earlier (whether an Abala herder was killed earlier and/or by whom is unconfirmed).
Paramilitary group attacked farmers in Gallab, beat and whipped them.
Paramilitary group raped four displaced girls in Jebel Kosbi 10kms from Shadad camp. 7 other girls missing.

Clashes between the Awlad Janoub subclan of the Northern Rezeigat clashed with Mahadi over land ownership in Um Tajok area, Kereinik locality, leaving 23 people dead, including one soldier, 12 Mahadi villages destroyed and 7,000 - 8,000 people displaced.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Army and police arrive in Um Tajok to break up violence between border guards militia and farmers that occurred on June 23. 1 soldier killed when government forces intervened on June 24.
Rioters damaged a commissioners vehicle as military and police arrived in Um Tajok to intervene in earlier clashes between Abala militia and farmers.
Protests against increased insecurity and looting in El Fasher.
Farmers on border of Kassala and El Gedaref states protest lease of land to Saudi investors.
Clashes between Misseriya Jebel and Awlad Zaid of the Northern Rezeigat over a farming and grazing dispute in Selea, West Darfur, left three people killed.
Unknown group on motorcycles kill a man in El Fasher.
Unknown group injure a boy in El Fasher. He died the next day.
Paramilitary who were robbing market in Saraf Omra then fired at a police station, injuring a detainee.
Displaced protest over increased insecurity in Shadad.
Paramilitary open fire on Jugma, injure 3 farmers.
Armed men beat and abduct a farmer north of Sortony camp.
Gunmen attack farmers in Um Arda. Shot 3 and raped another.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese army attacked SLM/A locations in Tui and Korambe in North Darfur near Sortony. Armed Arabs from the Rezeigat tribe and some RSF members later maintained presence on the road between Kabkabiyah and Sortony to prevent SLM/A forces from securing logistical supplies.
Gunmen attack and rape IDPs in Mesel, 1km from Khazan Tunjur.
Soldiers shot dead a student member of the Independent Students Conference in Zalingei.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese army attacked SLM/A locations in Tui and Korambe in North Darfur near Sortony. Armed Arabs from the Rezeigat tribe and some RSF members later maintained presence on the road between Kabkabiyah and Sortony to prevent SLM/A forces from securing logistical supplies.
Gunmen attack farmers Massalit.
Armed men hijack a vehicle and shoot the driver dead.
Gunmen beat and raped IDPS near Kayma, 10kms east of Tawila.
Farmer killed in Selea.
SAF dropped eight bombs on farms in Wadaka and Shali villages in the Wadaka and Shali payams respectively in Blue Nile. No casualties.
Gunmen shoot at 2 displaced students and seriously wound one in Nertiti.
SAF dropped eight bombs on farms in Wadaka and Shali villages in the Wadaka and Shali payams respectively in Blue Nile. No casualties.
Suspected Rezeigat militiamen killed a soldier in Ed Daein.
Militants shot and seriously injured civilian in Tur.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Looting: 16 unidentified armed men attacked two UNAMID security individual contractors guarding a water point in Labado, East Darfur, robbing them of their belongings and stealing a generator.
Pro-government militia killed 2 Dinka traders from Twic County in South Sudan and injured another two in the market of Anet in Abyei area.
SAF soldiers based in Habila County tried to livestock in Tunguli, Dalami county, South Kordofan. They were repelled by SPLA-N forces, but not before three cows and one goat had been killed.
SAF bomb Deribat. 2 farmers died.
Militiamen rape two girls and injure another in East Jebel Marrah. A farmer was also abducted near Mashrou Abu Zeid in Jabal Marrah.
Residents of Rumaylah and El Goz in Khartoum rioted calling for the removal of the government, burnt tyres and blocked roads. Police used tear gas and batons. No reports of injuries.

Felleta herders aided by Rezeigat attacked Masalit farmers in Um Assal, west of Gereida, South Darfur, leaving three killed and preventing other farmers from gaining access to farmland. Government forces were later deployed to contain the tensions and arrested seven suspects.
Hundreds of traders protested against removal of Nimir market in downtown Khartoum.
Paramilitary group kill a family of 5 in Gaba.
Paramilitaries shot a driver dead in Manawashi.
Militiamen exchanged fire with private security guards on board a customs vehicle. One guard wounded.
Four hours after 7 detainees arrested for suspected rebel ties, gunmen attacked police station in Umm Gumeima. Seized 1 police officer.
Clash between military and Rizaygat militia in Abu Saida in East Darfurs Assalaya locality. At least 9 soldiers killed.
Ethiopian Shifta militia kill 2 herders in Sudans El Gedaref state in the week of July 4. (5 other Sudanese farmers killed by unknown Ethiopian gunmen in same week).
Unknown Ethiopian gunmen launch attacks on civilians in Sudans El Gedaref state in the week of July 4. At least 5 farmers killed, 3 injured, bodies found near Wad Abu Lisan.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Cattle-rustling incident involving suspected SLM/A members and Nuwayba farmers in Central Darfur. Following the incident, armed Nawaiba abducted five Fur in Kude Mara, north-east of Nertiti, whom they released on 18 July following intervention of a local conflict resolution committee.

Cattle-rustling incident involving suspected SLM/A members and Nuwayba farmers in Central Darfur. Following the incident, armed Nawaiba abducted five Fur in Kude Mara, north-east of Nertiti, whom they released on 18 July following intervention of a local conflict resolution committee.
Arrests: Police arrest two Islamist militiamen in possession of grenades that were supposed to be used for suicide bombings during planned Eid celebrations.
Unexploded ordnance killed two children and wounded another in Um Sarir southeast of Mellit.
Gunmen on camels and horses stormed Tuktuka southeast of Foro Burunga, beat civilians, 2 women raped.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF raped a girl near Fanga.
Man non-fatally shot by herdsmen.
Members of a church clash with police who try to remove the priests and parishoners. The priests accuse the government of wanting to sell the land to investors.
A clash between militiamen and residents of the Mukjar camp results in serious injuries on both sides. The next day the militiamen return and severely beat the camp residents.
A clash between militiamen and residents of the Mukjar camp results in serious injuries on both sides. The next day the militiamen return and severely beat the camp residents with whips.
Four farmers are shot by herders in the Senger area near Kutum. No deaths reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Members of the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF)reportedly ambushed a convoy of three passenger lorries near El Melem in East Jebel Marra. The drivers are stripped and beaten by members of the paramilitary.
A woman and two children were killed in an air raid west of Deribat in Tawila locality.
Militiamen rob civilians west of Kebkabiya. Those that refuse to hand over their possessions are beaten with axes.

SAF bombed an area in the hills outside of Tourong Toara near Thur, wounding at least one person. The bombs are believed to have released poisonous chemical smokes in the air, causing long-lasting injuries.
Farmers demonstrate against insecurity in Kutum after four farmers are shot by herders.
Uniformed paramilitaries shoot a mother and daughter while attempting to steal a donkey.
A SAF artillery unit targeted the area west of Heiban town with long-range missiles. No casualties reported.

Maaliya youth held a protest in Adilla, East Darfur, against the Governors decision that militiamen involved in the April fighting in the state would not be prosecuted. The Governors decision came amid reports of further mobilization of Southern Rezeigat militias in the area.
The body of a paramilitary accused of stealing a donkey and shooting a mother and daughter is found in Nertiti on Monday.
Paramilitaries beat and abduct a sheikh and his brother.
Pro-government PDF militias attack farmers in Lima leading to 1 death and 1 serious injury.
A student is shot and killed by a paramilitary gunmen. In retaliation students riot and burn down the paramilitary compound.
Armed militants rob and kill a motorcyclist. The militants disagree over the division of the spoils prompting a battle in which one of them is killed.
Gunmen and Misseriya tribesmen exchange fire outside of Lagawa, resulting in 4 fatalities.
A tribal group of eight people assaulted and beat an Um Dukhun resident in the market.
Armed militants rob and kill a motorcyclist. The militants disagree over the division of the spoils prompting a battle in which one of them is killed.

Armed herdsmen attacked a group of farmers tilling their land at Sindinigo area, 15 kilometres west of Tabit in North Darfur. The herders beat and whipped them before stealing money, property, food, along with seven donkeys.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: A clash between members of the paramilitary Popular Defence Forces and Rapid Support Forces in Rokoro, Central Darfur, resulted in the death of three RSF members and one PDF member.
Gunmen fire into Forika IDP camp in South Darfur resulting in a woman sustaining a severe injury.
A student is shot and killed by a paramilitary gunmen. In retaliation students riot and burn down the paramilitary compound.
Paramilitary group members opened fire on three displaced people who were on their way from Bergi village to Deleig. One IDP killed.
The Sudan Armed Forces (SAF) and allied militias attacked SPLN-M positions in the area of Lima. Government forces reportedly suffered loss of lives and equipment.
In Nyala, capital of South Darfur, a woman was killed and her 18-year-old son was wounded in an attack by militiamen.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS arrested two people in the Belang area of Kurmuk in July over suspicions of being SPLM-N rebels or supporters. They were held for two months. At least one of them was beaten and detained in a container.
Paramilitary troops attacked the site of about 150 returnees near the village of Sandengo, 15 kilometres west of Tabit in Tawila locality.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM-AW and the military battle in Nertiti. Undetermined number of casualties reported.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: The Sudan Liberation Movement led by Abdelwahid El Nur (SLM-AW) claims to have killed 37 government troops in a battle near Nierteti. The rebel fighters claim to have gained control of the area of Boldong, seven kilometres east of Nierteti

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: The governor of North Darfur state Abdel-Wahid Youssef announced on Saturday the return of a Border Guards militia officer Musab al-Ahmed Mohamed Mahmoud, who defected in October 2013, with his troops and weapons. The defected group members were discharged from the service upon their movement to Mellit area during an attack by the rebels in October 2013.
Soldiers shell Deribat, killing a mother and child.
A large group of militiamen shot three displaced farmers dead and wounded six others in Gireida locality in South Darfur
Women beaten and raped by militiamen.
Agreement: Massalit and Falata tribes signed in South Darfur a reconciliation document to prevent future conflict between the groups. The signing was endorsed by the governor.
Militiamen rape women in Kaja near Shangil Tobaya.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM-AW and Sudanese military forces fight in Jebel Marrah resulting in 170 military fatalities and 4 rebel fatalities. SLM-AW gain control of Torentowra in Jebel Marrah.

Manjirni village near Gireida came under attack by gunmen riding camels and wearing military uniforms. They shot dead Yahya Mohamad Abaker, a displaced man, and wounded his brother Adil Yahya Mohamed Abakar.
Four women and girls were raped, and a fifth injured with a gunshot wound, when a gang of paramilitaries intercepted them north of camp Sortony in North Darfur

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Government forces fought against SLMA-Nur in Kalukidding, the entrance to Tourong-Toara, near Thur in southern Jebel Marrah in mid-January, February, April, late July, and August. Government forces were pushed out of Tourong-Toara by the SLA/AW in late July. Unknown number of people killed in the violence.

militiamen attacked six women who were farming near Um Gaji, 15 kilometres south of Tabit. They beat the women at gunpoint and raped two of them, aged 16 and 17.Another witness in Um Gaju said that three militiamen stormed the house of Ahmed El Nur, and shot him with three bullets.

Two children were killed and a woman was wounded when they were hit by an air raid on Kora, Tina, Turri, and Gorolang Banje, 25 kilometres north of Kass in South. Exact locations of casualties not known.

Two children were killed and a woman was wounded when they were hit by an air raid on Kora, Tina, Turri, and Gorolang Banje, 25 kilometres north of Kass in South. Exact locations of casualties not known.

Two children were killed and a woman was wounded when they were hit by an air raid on Kora, Tina, Turri, and Gorolang Banje, 25 kilometres north of Kass in South. Exact locations of casualties not known.
The SAF bomb Jebel Marrah resulting in the death of livestock and destruction of property.
An elderly farmer was beaten by herders in South Darfur.
Bombing sparked panic among the villagers of Njama, 25 kilometres from Tur

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Arrests: RSF arrest 600 migrants attempting to enter Egypt and Libya from the border areas in the north Sudan desert.
A sheikh is killed during a bombing run by the SAF.

column7: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Strikes: UNAMID staff go on strike and demand a retroactive salary adjustment, as well as other employment-related issues.
Three Janjaweed shoot dead a farmer.
Two farmers non-fatally shot by gunmen.
Ten militant herders opened fire on a group of farmers tending their farmlands near Hashaba village. No fatalities.
Paramilitary gunmen assault and rape women in East Jebel Marrah
reported fighting between SPLM-N and Sudan armed forces, resulting in death and injures of soldiers from both sides. The SAF also reportedly bomb the area during the battle.
10 Maalia militiamen attacked camps of Rizaygat communities in Al Mujilid, north of Ed Daein, leaving five people killed.
Unknown militiamen assaulted and raped two women in their farms near Dobo al-Omda in North Darfur.
Shelling by Sudan Armed Forces near Kakaro village in East Jebel Marra resulted in the death of the two brothers
SAF fired 60 shells on Tablo village, Tangal Payam, killing two people, a man and a woman and damaging a house.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Arrests: Sudans NISS allegedly arrested 21 IDP leaders in Nirtiti locality, Central Darfur, following a meeting with the US Special Envoy to Sudan and South Sudan.
SAF bomb Feena village in Jebel Marrah, killing livestock, no injuries or fatalities reported.
SPLM-N fired at a vehicle carrying 14 civilians from Dering locality to Balung village in Blue Nile, leaving two people injured and destroying the vehicle.

Eight Janjaweed militiamen opened fire on farmers protesting the militiamens forcible entry of cattle on their farmlands in Arkom village, a few kilometres from Bileil locality, killing one of them and injuring another four.

column8: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
column17: Unknown gunmen fired machine guns and rocket-propelled grenades near the UNISFA Tajalei operating base in Abyei.
SAF bomb Suwanee village in Jebel Marrah. A woman is severely injured during the bombing.

Movement of forces: The Sudanese military withdraw their garrisons from multiple locations inhabited by returned IDPs in east Darfur. The withdrawal of military forces from Muhajiriya, Labado, Khazan Jadeed, Selea, Sani Efendo, Kileikil Mojo, and Kileikil Abu Salama has sparked panic among the returnees.

Three Janjaweed militiamen, under the command and control structure of Badr Abu Keneish, kidnapped a boy grazing his sheep in Marar, Tawila locality, North Darfur and took him to an unknown destination.
Nine Janjaweed militiamen attacked seven civilians as they were travelling from Al-Brosh to Sleea in Ghazala Jawazat, leaving at least four injured.
Four Janjaweed militiamen, under the command and control structure of Badr Abu Keneish, shot and killed a Fur from Sangu village, North Darfur, as he refused to get off his donkey.
SAF bombed Fuju village east of Golol, leaving at least five severely wounded. The bombs are also believed to have released poisonous chemical smokes in the air, causing long-lasting injuries.

Five Janjaweed militiamen assaulted a student of the Gamir ethnic group in his farm in Guibi valley in Nertiti locality, Central Darfur, beating him and stealing his belongings. Another group of Janjaweed looted several stores in Nertiti at the same time.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SAF conducted aerial bombardments targeting SLM/A positions in Konda and Boranga areas, near Nertiti. SLM/A retaliated the next day with an attack on army positions in Kutum. No report of fatalities.
Residents of El Gedaref protest for two days and demand improvement of services during the wet season. Police respond with teargas and detain 300 of the demonstrators.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SAF conducted aerial bombardments targeting SLM/A positions in Konda and Boranga areas, near Nertiti. SLM/A retaliated the next day with an attack on army positions in Kutum. No report of fatalities.
Unidentified militiamen killed an ex-Janjaweed member in Taradona village, north Darfur, following his decision to leave the militia under the command of Badr Abu Keneish.
SPLM-N killed a farmer on his farm in Abigo village in Kurmuk locality, Blue Nile.
Sudanese airforce bombardments were carried out in the Kwele, Barbara and Kourou areas of western Jebel Marra without reports of casualties.

2 women were raped in front of their husbands by suspected Janjaweed militiamen (masked gunmen) in their farms in Gallab, North Darfur. Following the attack, the militiamen tied up the husbands with rope and fled.
3 women were raped at gunpoint by five Janjaweed militiamen (men in military uniforms riding camels and donkeys) at Katur village in North Darfur.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SAF conducted aerial bombardments targeting SLM/A positions in Konda and Boranga areas, near Nertiti. SLM/A retaliated the next day with an attack on army positions in Kutum. No report of fatalities.
7 soldiers were killed and 7 others wounded after an ambush of Sudanese military forces by Abbala tribesmen in East Jebel Marra.
Sudanese airforce bombardments were carried out in the Kwele, Barbara and Kourou areas of western Jebel Marra without reports of casualties.
5 members of a Jebel Marra family were killed in an attack by the Sudanese air force at Kabe near Guldo in the Jebel Marra area.
Unknown militiamen shot and killed a civilian at a TV club in Jamiza Kamura, near Kass, South Darfur. The reason for the attack is unclear.
Three Janjaweed militiamen shot and injured a lawyer in his home in South Darfur as he refused to hand them his mobile phone.

A father was killed and his daughter raped, allegedly by a member of the SAF in the Shimi area, north of El Kurmuk. The father was killed when he attempted to stop the soldier from assaulting his daughter.
Agreement: JEM, the SPLM-N and a faction of the SLA (Minnawi) signed an AU-brokered roadmap for peace with the government of Sudan in Ethiopias capital.
A youth was killed in aerial bombardment in Taring village in the Darfur area.
Looting: 2 shops were robbed by members of a paramilitary group led by Mohamed Sayed Ahmed that had been assigned to guard the market.
SAF bombs Sarrong in Central Darfur, leaving one person killed.

At least one person was killed in aerial bombings by SAF of Grlang, Bang and Tontonga villages in nort western/western Jebel Marra between 6 and 13 August. Livestock was also killed and several properties destroyed.
Unknown militiamen attacked famrs in Habila scheme in West Darfur, leaving three farmers killed and seven others injured.
Merchants of the Lagawa market protested and began a strike over a blockade by the security forces on Nuba Mountain trade.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: A female journalist from Al-Jareeda newspaper was assaulted by officials from the NISS as she was investigating the removal of a residential district in the south of Khartoum. She was also reportedly beaten during interrogation.
Several local youths angered by the demolition of an activists house clashed with the police. Many injuries were reported.
Sudanese airforce bombings destroyed an Arab nomadic settlement south of Fanga in East Jebel Marra. No casualties were reported but livestock were killed.
An elderly woman was killed in an SAF bombardment of the Garlanbanej area of East Jebel Marra.
Over the weekend, the SAF bombed an area near Kadugli town. No casualties were reported.
SPLM-N attacked civilians working in artisanal gold mining in Kiley in Kurmuk locality, Blue Nile, leaving five killed and three injured, and looting their belongings.
Janjaweed militiamen abducted two civilians from Tor in Nertiti locality, Central Darfur.
3 people were killed and 2 more injured in an attack by suspected Janjaweed in the Kutum locality.
Three Janjaweed militiamen kidnapped two civilians from their homes in Tor village, south of Jebel Marra.

A popular defence forces militiaman opened fire on three brothers from Shadad IDP camp in Shangil Tobay, causing serious injury. The attack allegedly followed a discussion by the three brothers on human rights abuses perpetrated by the government and its associated militias.
Arab militias attacked Zaghawa herders in Baashim, north Darfur, leaving three killed, two injured, five abducted and stealing livestock.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Government forces fought against SLMA-Nur in Kalukidding, the entrance to Tourong-Toara, near Thur in southern Jebel Marrah in mid-January, February, April, late July, and August. Government forces were pushed out of Tourong-Toara by the SLA/AW in late July. Unknown number of people killed in the violence.
2 Kabkabiya residents were robbed and assaulted by suspected Janjaweed. At least one was stabbed and later taken to a hospital.
Seven Janjaweed militiamen assaulted at least seven displaced persons in their farms in Zaligei as they refused to pay a fee to the militia for planting their fields.
SAF aircraft bombed the villages of Fori, Khazan Tunjur, Kidnair and Fina over a three-day period, causing the destruction of farmland and the death of livestock.

Two Janjaweed militiamen shot and killed a displaced civilian in Otasch IDP camp in Nyala as well as shot and injured a civilian in front of his home in the town. The motive of the attacks is unclear.
2 girls were raped by suspected Janjaweed gunmen in the Al-Gurud neighbourhood of Kadugli. The gilrs were also beaten by the men who wore military uniforms.
SAF aircraft bombed the villages of Fori, Khazan Tunjur, Kidnair and Fina over a three-day period, causing the destruction of farmland and the death of livestock.
SPLM-N kidnapped a teacher on his way to his farm in Dandaro village in Kurmuk locality, Blue Nile.
SAF aircraft bombed the villages of Fori, Khazan Tunjur, Kidnair and Fina over a three-day period, causing the destruction of farmland and the death of livestock.
Five Janjaweed militiamen assaulted and kidnapped two cattle jerders from Dobo Al-Omda village, north Darfur. They then proceeded to Malam.
3 women working as tea ladies in the Torog neighborhood of Dilling were assaulted and raped by 3 policemen as they returned to their homes after work.
A farmer was killed and another injured by suspected Janjaweed gunmen in the Brembo area near Mukjar.
SAF aircraft bombed the villages of Fori, Khazan Tunjur, Kidnair and Fina over a three-day period, causing the destruction of farmland and the death of livestock.
Three Janjaweed militiamen raped a woman on her way to her farm from her home in Bili village, a few kilometres from Kass.

Report of pastoralists attacking 13 villages and furgans in Kosa area, North Darfur to restore livestock stolen from them by an unidentified group west of Tawila. These attacks left three people killed, hundreds of livestock looted, and forced around 7,000 people to flee to Katur in Tawila locality.

A Janjaweed militiamen under the command and control sturcture of Hafiz Daoud shot three young men in the Kassab IDP camp in an unprovoked attack. One of them, a Fur student, was killed in the attack.
Members of the ""Zalingei Intelligence"" opened fire on an army officer as he was riding a motorcycle in Zalingei.

After 3 militiamen entered a house and demanded a meal be made for them, the residents resisted, which led the gunmen to open indiscriminately fire which injured a neighbour who was taken to hospital.

The Tomi, Golo and Soreng areas of western Jebel Marra in Central Darfur were targeted by bombing raids of the SAF. A number of livestock were killed and orchards damaged in the attacks. In Soreng, the bombs are also believed to have released poisonous chemical smokes in the air, leaving many injured.
2 girls were raped and a man was shot by a pair of suspected Janjaweed militiamen in the Nabagaya area.

The Tomi, Golo and Soreng areas of western Jebel Marra in Central Darfur were targeted by bombing raids of the SAF. A number of livestock were killed and orchards damaged in the attacks. In Soreng, the bombs are also believed to have released poisonous chemical smokes in the air, leaving many injured.
15 Janjaweed militiamen dressed in military uniform fired on 30 civilians making their way from Gereida locality to Hashaba market, leaving three IDPs injured, and stole their money and goods.

A woman was killed in an bombing raid by the SAF on Jebel Marra. The raids were conducted against Saboun El Fagur and Sina in Central Darfur, although it was not reported in which area the woman was killed. Cattle were also killed and orchards damaged in the attacks.

The Tomi, Golo and Soreng areas of western Jebel Marra in Central Darfur were targeted by bombing raids of the SAF. A number of livestock were killed and orchards damaged in the attacks. In Soreng, the bombs are also believed to have released poisonous chemical smokes in the air, leaving many injured.

A woman was killed in an bombing raid by the SAF on Jebel Marra. The raids were conducted against Saboun El Fagur and Sina in Central Darfur, although it was not reported in which area the woman was killed. Cattle were also killed and orchards damaged in the attacks.

1 person was killed and 2 herders injured when a security guard working for an Arab agricultural company shot the two herders and then killed another by running him over with a tractor. It was not clear what led to the incident.

1 refugee was killed and 4 injured at the Abu-Songur camp near Kosti town after a fight broke out between supporters of the newly appointed VP and supporters of Riek Machar. Police intervened to disperse the fighting, allegedly beating refugees indiscriminately and looting property.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS officers assaulted a journalist from Assayha newspaper as she was investigating the victims of a traffic accident in Turkish hospital. She was detained at the hospital for three hours and forced to write a statement saying that she would never enter the hospital for professional purposes again.

1 refugee was killed and 4 injured at the Abu-Songur camp near Kosti town after a fight broke out between supporters of the newly appointed VP and supporters of Riek Machar. Police intervened to disperse the fighting, and respond by indiscriminately allegedly beating refugees and looting property.
3 people were injured in a robbery of a vehicle travelling between Umu Khairat and Gireida by 8 suspected Janjaweed gunmen riding camels.

column9: Masalit Ethnic Group (Sudan); Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019)
column17: Felleta herders attacked Masalit farmers in the Towiel and Nabbagaya areas, east and west of Gereida on 22 and 27 August respectively, leaving 9 Masalit and 2 police personnel dead and another 12 injured. The attacks came despite an agreement on the cessation of hostilities signed between the two groups on 20 July.

Three Janjaweed militiamen under the command and control structure of Badr Abu Keneish attacked and looted the belongings and livestock of a Tungur farmer on his farm in the Abu Zaid Agricultural Scheme, west of Tabit. The farmer was shot in the leg as he sought to protect his livestock. The militiamen forced fozens of farmers to flee as they fired in the air and looted their properties and livestock when they fled north toward Seswa village.

A Janjaweed militia under the command and control structure of Fadul al-Nagi kidnapped six Fur persons from Adidi village in North Darfur after an incident in which a farmer from Dankoj IDP camp hit and injured a camel while driving. They were taken to the commanders residence in Basm village in Saraf Omra locality and released after a ransom was paid.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS officers assaulted a journalist from Assayha newspaper as he was investigating allegations of assault by NISS and police personnel on women working in selling food and tea. They confiscated his mobile phone and detained him at the police station.
A landmine exploded while camels were grazing in the Aradeeb El Ashara area of Jebel Marra, killing 8 camels and resulting in the later deaths of 7 others.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Gunmen believed to be from the Sudan Liberation Movement (SLM-AW) led by Abdel-Wahid al-Nour attacked a herder settlement near Tawila, killing at least two people and stealing about 1,000 livestock. The herders gathered in the area near Katur village, west of Tabit, following the event.
Four Janjaweed militiamen shot a farmer in his farm in Tawila village a few kilometres from Gereida locality, before stealing his cash and mobile phone, leaving him seriously injured.

Agreement: Leaders of the Maaliya and Rizeigat tribes signed a comprehensive peace accord in El Muglad in West Kordofan. On 3 September however, representatives of the Maaliya subclans claimed that it was not inclusive of the entire Maaliya community and that it had not been signed by the actual representatives of the Agarba.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a herder settlement near Katur village, west of Tabit, North Darfur, clashing with armed herdsmen. When they had to retreat, the herdsmen stole livestock from surrounding villages, killing four villagers from Gabes, El Faki Idris, Doba and Angeirogi villages who resisted, and abducting three from Angeirogi, Tamra and El Faki Hamid villages.

A member of the Misseriya clan stabbed to death the leader of another armed group, Al Nazir Othman Gumma, in al Daliam village, Babanusa area, in Kordofan, over a dispute. Police arrested four suspects in relations with the event.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a herder settlement near Katur village, west of Tabit, North Darfur, clashing with armed herdsmen. When they had to retreat, the herdsmen stole livestock from surrounding villages, killing four villagers from Gabes, El Faki Idris, Doba and Angeirogi villages who resisted, and abducting three from Angeirogi, Tamra and El Faki Hamid villages.

column9: Masalit Ethnic Group (Sudan); Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019)
column17: Felleta herders attacked Masalit farmers in the Towiel and Nabbagaya areas, east and west of Gereida on 22 and 27 August respectively, leaving 9 Masalit and 2 police personnel dead and another 12 injured. The attacks came despite an agreement on the cessation of hostilities signed between the two groups on 20 July.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SAF conducted aerial bombardments targeting SLM/A positions in Boldon, Central Darfur. No report of fatalities.

SAF allegedly dropped 12 barrel bombs in air raids on seven villages surrounding Jebel Marra over two days. The affected villages were near Sorong (Togi, Qabas, Taliba, Al Earadib Al Ashra, Kurai Fal) and Gildo (Barbari, Turrentqa). In Togi, the bombing resulted in the loss of a mans legs and the killing a large number of livestock.

A displaced farmer was killed, and five others were injured in an attack by 10 Janjaweed militiamen in military uniform while passing through Nabagaya village on their way from the Gireida camps to Eedan village in Gerida locality, South Darfur, to tend their lands.

Unidentified gunmen exchanged fire in Hashaba west of Gerida, South Darfur, with a group of locals who were chasing the perpetrators of the murder of a displaced farmer the day prior in Gerida, killing three locals, injuring ten and abducting seven. The assailants then fired on the policemen that rushed to the scene in the afternoon, killing the police Chief of Operations and injuring another six police officers. The attackers managed to seize two police vehicles.

Unidentified gunmen exchanged fire in Hashaba west of Gerida, South Darfur, with a group of locals who were chasing the perpetrators of the murder of a displaced farmer the day prior in Gerida, killing three locals, injuring ten and abducting seven. The assailants then fired on the policemen that rushed to the scene in the afternoon, killing the police Chief of Operations and injuring another six police officers. The attackers managed to seize two police vehicles.
SAF allegedly conducted air raids targeting areas near the villages of Gabes, Talba, and El Aradeib El Ashara in Tawila locality, killing a number of livestock.
A group of 25 Janjaweed militiamen attacked displaced farmers on their way to Katur, killing three and injuring another four.
Three Janjaweed militiamen assaulted and raped a Bargo woman in Srambanga village in Kass locality, South Darfur, as she left her home to collect firewood.
Clashes over agricultural land killed two people and injured 15 others in Jadid Al-Seil area, close to El-Fasher in North Darfur. Police later arrested seven people in connection with the violence.

Non-violent activity: Militiamen stormed the weekly Birkat Seira market in Saraf Umra locality in North Darfur firing into the air, forcing traders to shut their shops. The incident came against the backdrop of the militants being removed from the duty of guarding the market following the killing of a student in July.
SPLM-N abduct a shepherd in South Kordofan and take him to their base in Tassi. On the same day, they looted livestock from another shepherd.
A police officer raped a young girl in Al-Jebel neighbourhood of Al-Geneina, West Darfur. He was sentenced to 20 years in prison and fined two months later by the Darfur Crimes Court.
SAF attacked a local civilian in Al-Nasr neighborhood of Damazin, leaving him severely injured. They stole his phone and money.

SPLM-N attacked ethnic Falatas in Addasi area of Geissan locality over suspisions of cooperation with the government in targeting Ingessana ethnic members in an attempt to seize their land, leaving three shephers dead and livestock looted.

Residents and displaced people in rebel-held areas in Blue Nile demonstrated against fighting between the Sudanese army and armed rebel movements in Blue Nile on the fifth anniversary of the outbreak of war in the state.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Two border guard militiamen dressed in military uniform opened fire on a husband and wife in Kabkabiya county, North Darfur, killing the husband, and leaving his wife severely injured. Upon hearing gunfire, neighbors rushed to the scene and were also fired upon. No arrest as of two months later, although one of the perpetrators had been identified.

A force of 70 members of the Baggara militia, most of whom are also members of the PDF militia, attacked al-Sanadra and al-Shawaya villages in Abassiya, South Kordofan, killing at least 8 people, injuring another 11, and ransacking the villages. The villages are mostly inhabited by displaced Nubas. Thousands of residents from the area held a sit-in in front of the Abassiya hospital following the incident, demanding the arrest and trial of the perpetrators, the immediate dismissal of the Commissioner of Abbasiya locality, and a thorough review of the presence of security troops in the area. The sit-in moved into a street demonstration two days later after a speech delivered by the South Kordofan governor. 11 suspects were arrested a month later in connection with the attack.

A force of 70 members of the Baggara militia, most of whom are also members of the PDF militia, attacked al-Sanadra and al-Shawaya villages in Abassiya, South Kordofan, killing at least 8 people, injuring another 11, and ransacking the villages. The villages are mostly inhabited by displaced Nubas. Thousands of residents from the area held a sit-in in front of the Abassiya hospital following the incident, demanding the arrest and trial of the perpetrators, the immediate dismissal of the Commissioner of Abbasiya locality, and a thorough review of the presence of security troops in the area. The sit-in moved into a street demonstration two days later after a speech delivered by the South Kordofan governor. 11 suspects were arrested a month later in connection with the attack.

Residents of El Fetehab and El Salha in Omdurman and of El Goz in Khartoum protested against prolonged water cuts in the areas, demanding the dismissal of the Commissioner of Khartoum. Police allegedly intervened to break up the demonstrations.

Residents of El Fetehab and El Salha in Omdurman and of El Goz in Khartoum protested against prolonged water cuts in the areas, demanding the dismissal of the Commissioner of Khartoum. Police allegedly intervened to break up the demonstrations.

A force of 70 members of the Baggara militia, most of whom are also members of the PDF militia, attacked al-Sanadra and al-Shawaya villages in Abassiya, South Kordofan, killing at least 8 people, injuring another 11, and ransacking the villages. The villages are mostly inhabited by displaced Nubas. Thousands of residents from the area held a sit-in in front of the Abassiya hospital following the incident, demanding the arrest and trial of the perpetrators, the immediate dismissal of the Commissioner of Abbasiya locality, and a thorough review of the presence of security troops in the area. The sit-in moved into a street demonstration two days later after a speech delivered by the South Kordofan governor. 11 suspects were arrested a month later in connection with the attack.
An armed cattle herder shot dead two farmers who were trying to force cattle off their farmlands in Saraf Omra locality, North Darfur, killing two and wounding another two.

A force of 70 members of the Baggara militia, most of whom are also members of the PDF militia, attacked al-Sanadra and al-Shawaya villages in Abassiya, South Kordofan, killing at least 8 people, injuring another 11, and ransacking the villages. The villages are mostly inhabited by displaced Nubas. Thousands of residents from the area held a sit-in in front of the Abassiya hospital following the incident, demanding the arrest and trial of the perpetrators, the immediate dismissal of the Commissioner of Abbasiya locality, and a thorough review of the presence of security troops in the area. The sit-in moved into a street demonstration two days later after a speech delivered by the South Kordofan governor. 11 suspects were arrested a month later in connection with the attack.

Sudanese forces allegedly shelled five SPLM-controlled areas of South Kordofans Um Dorain county, in Um Sirdiba, Alnagra, Kaen, Tblo Allbo areas, and Um Dorain town for five consecutive days, killing one person, destroying property and forcing hundreds of civilians to flee.
Looting: SAF looted livestock from a civilian as he was herding his livestock close to the forces base in Damazin.
Looting: Seven Janjaweed militiamen from the Tungur ethnic group attacked a passenger bus in Fedwa village, 35km from Kass, looting property. No casualty.
Clashes between unknown gunmen using RPGs, grenades and guns and IDPs that fought back in exchange of fire at market near Sortony. 3 killed, 4 injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: A militiaman from the the Sudanese Central Reserve Forces (popularly known as Abu Tira) allegedly raped a girl in El Taweisha locality, North Darfur.

Sudanese forces allegedly shelled five SPLM-controlled areas of South Kordofans Um Dorain county, in Um Sirdiba, Alnagra, Kaen, Tblo Allbo areas, and Um Dorain town for five consecutive days, killing one person, destroying property and forcing hundreds of civilians to flee.

Residents of Abbasiya, Banet and other residential areas in Omdurman protested against water supply cuts for the past few days, burning tires and preventing access to the main street during their protests.
Five Janjaweed militiamen assaulted and raped a displaced woman from the Fur ethnic group as she was on her way from the Rwanda IDP camp to her farm in Um Barnqa village, near Tawila.
Herders beat farmers who were trying resist them driving their cattle and sheep onto their farms in Saraf Umra locality in North Darfur, injuring four farmers, including two seriously.
Clashes between Awlad Umran and the Awlad Saror branches of the Misseriya tribe over two days in Abyei left aroun 43 killed and at least one injured. No SAF intervention.
Three Janjaweed militiamen shot a civilian on his way to Kass market from Bronga village, leaving him injured and looting his belongings.

Sudanese forces allegedly shelled five SPLM-controlled areas of South Kordofans Um Dorain county, in Um Sirdiba, Alnagra, Kaen, Tblo Allbo areas, and Um Dorain town for five consecutive days, killing one person, destroying property and forcing hundreds of civilians to flee.

Security and police forces fired into the air, beat and subjected some students to tear gas, and arrested at least one student in a pre-emptive raid on El Fasher University campus in North Darfur to prevent a student demonstration over the Presidents planned visit to El Fasher to mark the completion of implementation of the Doha Document for Peace in Darfur (DDPD) and the consequent dismantling of the Darfur Regional Authority (DRA).
Residents of El Gedaref protest for two days and demand improvement of services during the wet season. Police respond with teargas and detain 300 of the demonstrators.
Four Janjaweed militiamen from the Beni Halba ethnic group killed a civilian in his home in Loai village in South Darfur for unclear reasons. No possessions were looted.
Clashes between Awlad Umran and the Awlad Saror branches of the Misseriya tribe over two days in Abyei left aroun 43 killed and at least one injured. No SAF intervention.

The SAF fire shells on Kubula village, Dalami County, from Umethan town where their base is located. Seven shells were fired on a civilian settlement but there were no human casualties or property damaged
Three unknown armed robbers shot and killed a Misseriya trader and seriously wounded another person travelling in a vehicle north of Todach in Abyei.

Sudanese forces allegedly shelled five SPLM-controlled areas of South Kordofans Um Dorain county, in Um Sirdiba, Alnagra, Kaen, Tblo Allbo areas, and Um Dorain town for five consecutive days, killing one person, destroying property and forcing hundreds of civilians to flee.
Two SAF MiG jet fighters dropped four bombs on Shat Tabadi village, Krongo Payam but there were no casualties
A group of 10 janjaweed militiamen raided the Kebkabiya market in North Darfur, leaving at least two people wounded and looting a number of shops.
SAF shot at two civilians while on their way to El Nama market in north Abyei. The forces took them to the Nama military garrison and asked them for money to retrieve their vehicles.
A rocket-propelled grenade explosion killed four teens as they played with it in Buth village, east of Babanusa town in Sudan's West Kordofan State.
SPLM-N killed a civilian tending to his farm in Al-Qarya Ashra village of Geissan locality. The victim was a member of the ruling NCP.
Medical doctors in Wad Medani in El Gezira embarked on an open-ended strike after a group of policemen insulted and beat two 'specialists in training' on that day.

Sudanese forces allegedly shelled five SPLM-controlled areas of South Kordofans Um Dorain county, in Um Sirdiba, Alnagra, Kaen, Tblo Allbo areas, and Um Dorain town for five consecutive days, killing one person, destroying property and forcing hundreds of civilians to flee.
Police reportedly beat a student of the faculty of Islamic studies at El Gedaref university in Kassala state leaving him severely injured.
Strike:Medical doctors in Wad Medani in El Gezira embarked on an open-ended strike after a group of policemen insulted and beat two 'specialists in training' on that day.

Unidentified gunmen abducted three civilians, including a Fur from Al-Hamadia IDP camp, in the border region between Libya and Sudan and imprisoned them on the Libyan side of the border at Ajdabiya along with 25 other Sudanese civilians. The abducted persons had entrusted the help of smugglers for their journey to Libya.

Students at El Gedaref University, Kassala state, staged a demonstration to protest police violence against students as well as recent fuel price hikes in the country. The students prevented traffic on the national road between Kassala and El Gedaref for two hours, until police intervened to disperse them, firing teargas and detaining one of them.

Traders and shop owners in Kabkabiya, North Darfur closed their stores and stalls in protest against repeated assaults by militiamen. The Chamber of Commerce requested the localities commissioner to intervene but attacks continued in the following weeks.

Two Janjaweed militiamen killed a gold trader in his home in Al-Qetina village, 10km north of Kass. The militiamen had already been arrested for attacking the gold trader a few months prior with the intention of looting him.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
column17: Members of the national security services allegedly beat a displaced man living in Mukjar camp in Central Darfur over his alleged collaboration with armed opposition groups, leaving him in a state of coma in a farm between Korfota and Mukjar.
Two Janjaweed militiamen killed two farmers tending their lands 2km from Jumizha Kamora village for refusing to hand them their possessions.
Pro-government militiamen allegedly kidnapped three persons for a ransom in Korma, North Darfur, forcing them into their vehicle at gunpoint.
A pro-government militia shot and killed a student in Abassiya Tagali area, South Kordofan.

Three Janjaweed militiamen killed a displaced farmer on his way to his farm in Bela village, 15km south of Kass, as he refused to hand them his belongings. On the same day, a bigger group of seven Janjaweed shot dead a civilian driving his family back from Kass ater Eid, also looting their possessions.
Four Janjaweed militiamen abducted two Fur men in Dobo El Omda in North Darfur. Reasons are unclear.
Three Janjaweed militiamen led by Ahmed al-Ghali abducted a displaced man in his farm near Silk IDP camp in Korma, taking him to Gunjar Mount and later demanding 100,000 SDG for his release.

Clashes between Misseriya farmers and Hamar herdsmen in West Kordofan allegedly killed 7 in the Um Jak area. Associations of respective groups described the event as isolated, calling on the government to prevent more frictions by regulating the grazing and farming in the state.
Police exchanged fire with a paramilitary group attempting to burgle a shop at Kabkabiya market in North Darfur, leaving one police officer shot and injured.

SAF dropped 12 barrel bombs on Logi village, 6km south of Fanga area in Tawila locality, killing three people and dozens of cattle, and forcing people living in the rea to flee to neighbouring valleys and mountains.

Unknown gunmen killed two oil engineers when they were carrying on their routine check on oil fields in West Kordofan state in September 2016. Two suspected were arrested in October and in April 2017.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Four members of the National Intelligence and Security Service beat and abducted a man at his house in El Menshiya neighborhood of Khartoum. He was later found in El Hawiyat, south of Khartoum, carrying marks of torture on his body. The event allegedly occurred after a conflict he had with a State Minister during an event at the presidential palace.

Unknown militiamen killed four Fur students and injured another one on their way from Bronga near Kass to their homes in Dogenj in East Jebel Marra. Several locals traced the perpetrators into a neighbourhood, where the gunmen shot at them and seriously wounded one. The following day, a group of civilian representatives of camps in East Jebel Marra led a demonstration, breaking into the resident of the Chief and smashing glass on a vehicle. Police fired teargas and shot in the air to disperse them. One person was injured in the demonstration.

Unknown militiamen killed four Fur students and injured another one on their way from Bronga near Kass to their homes in Dogenj in East Jebel Marra. Several locals traced the perpetrators into a neighbourhood, where the gunmen shot at them and seriously wounded one. The following day, a group of civilian representatives of camps in East Jebel Marra led a demonstration, breaking into the resident of the Chief and smashing glass on a vehicle. Police fired teargas and shot in the air to disperse them. One person was injured in the demonstration.

column6: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: A UNAMID vehicle ran over a girl near the Abbasi IDP camp in Mellit, North Darfur, and did not stop after the accident, allegedly due to lack of an interpreter among them. The deceaseds family filed a complaint to police authorities and protested at the UNAMID headquarters in the locality over the accident and the refusal of the UNAMID patrol to stop.

Three Janjaweed militiamen killed a civilian in Shangel Tobayei after earlier agreeing with the victim that they would buy his camel. Local civilians mobilised into a 500 strong group and managed to trace the militiamen, capture them and bring them to the police headquarters in El Fasher.
Janjajweed militiamen abducted two Fur civilians at gunpoint from Garsila IDP camp over allegedly owing them money, taking them to Damra mountain.

Two women were taken by unidentified men on motorbikes as they were on their way to a wedding party in Talodi, South Kordofan, and raped near the offices of the NISS in Talodi. The attackers had pretended to be police officers arresting them for being SPLM-N supporters. The next day, police reportedly forced the victims to accuse two men, including a government employee, known for criticizing the behavior of government officials. They have been detained since, although the victims confessed that the two men were falsely accused.
Seven Janjaweed militiamen led by Ahmed al-Ghali shot and injured a displaced man in Silk IDP camp in Korma as he tried to prevent them from looting his shop.
Doctors and health insurance staff in West Darfur began a strike following violence by a group of militiamen that left several people injured in a pharmacy in Foro Burunga.

Nine Janjaweed militiamen shot and beat two displaced civilians on their way from the Rwanda IDP camp to their farms in Kungara village, near Tawila, leaving them severely injured. SAF based in Tawila traced the perpetrators and exchanged fire while attempting to apprehend them, forcing them to withdraw.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: A large Border Guards contingent in 25 Land Cruisers raided Tema and Dunki Beashym villages, 25km north of Kutum, over a two-day period, resulitng in the death of six civilians and the injury of one at Tema village, the abduction of 10 civilians at both villages and the looting of properties and livestock.

In the context of attacks against SLM/A-Nur positions, a combined force of pro-gpvernment and Janjaweed militiamen attacked nine villages in north and west Jebel Marra (Barbara, Tora, Mara, Kndwa, Rara, Korgie, Kabi, Kowila, Kaby Kandi), leaving nine people killed (including 3 in Korgie and 1 in Mara), including among Fur populations, 11 injured, and widespread looting and destruction of homes. Hundreds of families were displaced to IDP camps in Nertiti and Zaligei and to Tor and Gildo localities.

In the context of attacks against SLM/A-Nur positions, a combined force of pro-gpvernment and Janjaweed militiamen attacked nine villages in north and west Jebel Marra (Barbara, Tora, Mara, Kndwa, Rara, Korgie, Kabi, Kowila, Kaby Kandi), leaving nine people killed (including 3 in Korgie and 1 in Mara), including among Fur populations, 11 injured, and widespread looting and destruction of homes. Hundreds of families were displaced to IDP camps in Nertiti and Zaligei and to Tor and Gildo localities.

In the context of attacks against SLM/A-Nur positions, a combined force of pro-gpvernment and Janjaweed militiamen attacked nine villages in north and west Jebel Marra (Barbara, Tora, Mara, Kndwa, Rara, Korgie, Kabi, Kowila, Kaby Kandi), leaving nine people killed (including 3 in Korgie and 1 in Mara), including among Fur populations, 11 injured, and widespread looting and destruction of homes. Hundreds of families were displaced to IDP camps in Nertiti and Zaligei and to Tor and Gildo localities.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudan Liberation Movement forces led by Abdelwahid El Nur allegedly repelled several attacks by government troops and an allied militia over 17 - 19 September in Berbera, Sawa, Baga areas of western Jebel Marra, and in Boro, Keiti, and Jertaga areas in north-west Jebel Marra. 107 soldiers were alleged killed, including 47 on the first day of fighting, another 71 were left injured, seven vehicles were destroyed and dozens of weapons were seized. At least one rebel fighter was also killed and three others injured in the attacks.

In the context of attacks against SLM/A-Nur positions, a combined force of pro-gpvernment and Janjaweed militiamen attacked nine villages in north and west Jebel Marra (Barbara, Tora, Mara, Kndwa, Rara, Korgie, Kabi, Kowila, Kaby Kandi), leaving nine people killed (including 3 in Korgie and 1 in Mara), including among Fur populations, 11 injured, and widespread looting and destruction of homes. Hundreds of families were displaced to IDP camps in Nertiti and Zaligei and to Tor and Gildo localities.

Nine Janjaweed militiamen shot and beat two displaced civilians on their way from the Rwanda IDP camp to their farms in Kungara village, near Tawila, leaving them severely injured. SAF based in Tawila traced the perpetrators and exchanged fire while attempting to apprehend them, forcing them to withdraw.

500 people from the villages of Halfa, Abari, Mefraka, Sai, Aboud, and Kuweika demonstrated in Sawadera in Sudans Northern State against the use of cyanide in gold mining near a water station in the area. They presented a memorandum to local authorities demanding the immediate closure of the gold extracting facilities in the area.

In the context of attacks against SLM/A-Nur positions, a combined force of pro-gpvernment and Janjaweed militiamen attacked nine villages in north and west Jebel Marra (Barbara, Tora, Mara, Kndwa, Rara, Korgie, Kabi, Kowila, Kaby Kandi), leaving nine people killed (including 3 in Korgie and 1 in Mara), including among Fur populations, 11 injured, and widespread looting and destruction of homes. Hundreds of families were displaced to IDP camps in Nertiti and Zaligei and to Tor and Gildo localities.
Strike:Doctors and health insurance staff in West Darfur began a strike following violence by a group of militiamen that left several people injured in a pharmacy in Foro Burunga.
Unidentified gunmen shot and seriously injured two people in an attack in Kabkabiya, North Darfur. Repeated attacks have been carried out in the area.

Two herders killed a member of the paramilitary Popular Defence Forces (PDF) in a scuffle near Dibla village, south-east of Shangil Tobaya in Tawila locality. They were later arrested by a group of PDF and residents in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: A large Border Guards contingent in 25 Land Cruisers raided Tema and Dunki Beashym villages, 25km north of Kutum, over a two-day period, resulitng in the death of six civilians and the injury of one at Tema village, the abduction of 10 civilians at both villages and the looting of properties and livestock.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudan Liberation Movement forces led by Abdelwahid El Nur allegedly repelled several attacks by government troops and an allied militia over 17 - 19 September in Berbera, Sawa, Baga areas of western Jebel Marra, and in Boro, Keiti, and Jertaga areas in north-west Jebel Marra. 107 soldiers were alleged killed, including 47 on the first day of fighting, another 71 were left injured, seven vehicles were destroyed and dozens of weapons were seized. At least one rebel fighter was also killed and three others injured in the attacks.

A combined force of pro-government and janjaweed militiamen attacked Al-Shamaliya IDP camp following their return from attacks in Jebel Marra, looting property and beating and arresting IDPs, including one suspected of being a rebel and a Fur.

SAF dropped 18 barrel bombs on the villages of Sirysam, Kutrum, Loki and Kirfal over two days, causing panic among populations. No mentioned casualty. The bombings came amid clashes between government troops and members of the SLM/A (Al Nur faction) in Jebel Marra.

SAF dropped 18 barrel bombs on the villages of Sirysam, Kutrum, Loki and Kirfal over two days, causing panic among populations. No mentioned casualty. The bombings came amid clashes between government troops and members of the SLM/A (Al Nur faction) in Jebel Marra.
Agreement: Tribes residing in Kabkabiya in North Darfur signed a document to enhance peaceful co-existence, fight against crime and promote security in the locality.

Looting: Militiamen seized 16 commercial vehicles in the Ed Elnabag area on their way from El Fasher to Kabkabiya, and only released them two days later after the owners paid a newly imposed large ""toll"".
Gunmen attacked farmers in Dilli, west of Kabkabiya, North Darfur, leaving three wounded.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudan Liberation Movement forces led by Abdelwahid El Nur allegedly repelled several attacks by government troops and an allied militia over 17 - 19 September in Berbera, Sawa, Baga areas of western Jebel Marra, and in Boro, Keiti, and Jertaga areas in north-west Jebel Marra. 107 soldiers were alleged killed, including 47 on the first day of fighting, another 71 were left injured, seven vehicles were destroyed and dozens of weapons were seized. At least one rebel fighter was also killed and three others injured in the attacks.
Three Janjaweed militiamen killed a Fur farmer in the Abu Zaid Agricultural Scheme near Tabit for refusing access to their camels onto his farmland.
Members of a paramilitary group fired bullets at two commercial vehicles on their way to shopping on the Tawila-Koninga road, seizing passengers belongings and the vehicles.

Four Janjaweed militiamen attacked a commercial vehicle in Shaq Al-Nakhara mountain, near Kutum, injuring the driver and looting the goods. The militiamen then fled to Goba area. Transportation stopped to El Fasher.
Gunmen shot and killed a student from the University of Nyala on his way to the Jebel Amer mines in El Sareif Beni Hussein locality in North Darfur.
Four Janjaweed militiamen allegedly abducted two women on their way from their farms in west Tabit, Tawila locality, North Darfur. They were taken to Badi, the headquarters of the militia.
Unidentified armed men allegedly killed a civilian in Dalal Angar, South Darfur, on his way from the market in Dalal Nagar to his village in Kardi.
A group of herdsmen allegedly shot and killed a farmer who was trying to chase them away from his farm in Mashrou Abu Zeid in East Jebel Marra.

SAF dropped four barrel bombs on the Dalo area of Jebel Marra, destroying several homes and a number of cattle, and forcing residents to flee.
